Su Chiang participa en el banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad de Su Chiang es la elaboración de productos en base a la Soya.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  

Su Chiang requiere el préstamo para comprar soya.   

Su Chiang se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Su Chiang is a member of Inti Pakareq, an Asociacion Arariwa community bank in Cusco. She operates a business making soy-based products.  She has owned the business for several years and is satisfied with the progress she's made.
 
Su Chiang will use this loan to buy supplies of soybeans for her business.

Su Chiang is grateful for the opportunity that this type of lending provides and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy soy for her retail business.

loans.name: Duo Shama Group

texts.es:
DUO SHAMA
Este dúo está formado por doña Leona D. 54 años, casada y tiene 2 hijos,la lider D. este duo, ella tiene una pequeña venta D. leña y pan y venD. todos los dias en su casa desD. hace 12 años, nos cuenta que está solicitando este crédito para la compra D. leña por mayor para poder seguir vendiendo ya que ahora la gente ya la conoce y le compra mucho, pero a veces cuando ella piD. la leña por mayor para la venta no hay, entonces necesita comprar mucho y así tener almacenado, para la venta, también esta doña Maria, D. 29 años, tiene 2 hijos y es casada, ella venD. ropa típica en su casa desD. hace 12 años, y nos cuenta que solicita este crédito ya que ahora no tiene cortes típicos, solo güipiles y blusas y ahora la gente empieza a pedir trajes completos entonces necesita comprar cortes y poder surtir su negocio ya que la gente la va a ir a buscar y ella no tiene lo que le piden entonces necesita comprar para poder tener lo necesario y hacer una buena venta este fin D. año, esta muy contenta por la oportunidad que se le conceD. D. poder obtener un crédito espera no defraudar a la fundación con este apoyo que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Dúo Shama is Leona, 54, and María, 29.

Leona is married and has two children.  The leader of this duo, she has a small firewood and bread business, and she has been selling out of her home every day for 12 years.  She tells us that she's requesting this loan because she needs to buy firewood to be able to continue selling it, since now everybody knows her and they buy from her a lot.  Sometimes when she asks for firewood wholesale there isn't any, so she needs to buy a lot and so have it stored for sale.

María, 29, has two children and is married.  She has been selling traditional clothing in her home for 12 years.  She tells us that she's requesting this loan because she doesn't have typical cuts, only huipils [traditional woven blouse or tunic] and blouses, and now people are beginning to ask for complete suits.  She needs to buy suits to be able to stock her business, since people are going to be looking for her and she doesn't have what they want.  So she needs to buy in order to be able to have the necessary items and make good sales at the end of the year.

She is very happy about the opportunity that is being given her to be able to get a loan.  She hopes she won't disappoint the Fundación with this support that is being given.

loans.use: to buy wholesale firewood for sale.

loans.name: Adriana Victoria

texts.es:
Adriana sigue elaborando sus trabajos con madera, junto asu esposo que tambien ejerce la profesion,  pues es su medio para sobresalir adelante con sus hijos, con el financiamiento anterior logro comprar una maquina que deja mejor acabado en sus sillas de junco, comedor, todo con madera.
Su hijo mayor cursa la primaria, y su bebe de dos años quien esta, a su cuidado, su objetivo a futuro es poder tener su propio casa, ya que vive con sus suegro aparte.
Con este nuevo prestamo es para la compra de lijas, maderas, junco, barnic, pega de madera, brochas, teniendo el material necesario para seguir procesando sus productos.
texts.en:
Adriana and her husband continue making furniture out of wood.  This is the way they plan to have their children get way ahead. She used the previous loan to buy a machine to better finish her cane chairs and dining set, all out of wood.

Her oldest son is in primary school and her two-year-old baby is at home with her.  Her goal for the future is to have her own house, since she now lives with her in-laws.

She will use the new loan to buy sandpaper, wood, cane, varnish, wood glue, and brushes, so that she has all necessary materials to continue working with her products.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish up her wooden furniture such as dining sets, rocking chairs, dressers, and more

loans.name: Colonia Modelo Group

texts.es:
La señora Simona, de 59 años de edad, vive en un Barrio suburbano de San Pedro Sula, madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 27, 26, 16 y 14 años de edad. Sus dos hijas menores estan estutiando.
Al no tener ayuda económica de su esposo, ella decide iniciar un negocio que le genere ingresos para el hogar y estudios de sus hijas. y  hace  aproximadamente 8 años  que vende ropa, nueva y usada y venta de carteras, sus ventas son a domicilio. Cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas para vender.
Este es su primer prestamo con ODEF, y lo ha invertido en compra de mas ropa para incrementar el inventario , ya que va aprovechar la temporada alta de navidad.
Todo este esfuerzo es para lograr que sus hijas terminen sus estudios. 

Doña Simona (En medio, de blusa color Rosado), es miembro de un grupo llamado COLONIA MODELO, que esta formado por dos personas más, la señora María Reina y Danubia. Doña Reina( Derecha, la de blusa color café) de  54 años de edad se dedica a la venta de comida en una cafetería,  Danubia  (a la izquierda, la de blusa color Blanco)tiene 32 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de productos ARABELLA (cosméticos) y ropa. Cada una ha solicitado un préstamo de L.5,700.00, haciendo un total en grupo de L.17,100.00.
texts.en:
Simona is 59 years old, and she lives in the suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  She is a single mother, and she has four children; ages 27, 26, 16, and 14.  Her two youngest daughters are in school.

Not having financial help from her husband, she decided to start a business to generate income for her household and for her daughters’ education.  She has been selling new and used clothes and wallets for approximately eight years.  She sells door to door, and her daughters help her sell.

This is her first loan with ODEF.  She has used it to buy more clothes in order to increase her inventory.  She is going to take advantage of the peak Christmas season.  All of this effort is to manage to have her daughters finish their education.

Simona (in the middle with the pink shirt) is a member of the Colonia Modelo group.  The group is comprised of two other people, María Reina and Danubia.  Reina (right, with a brown shirt) is 54 years old and she sells food in a cafeteria.  Danubia (left, with a white shirt) is 32 years old, and she sells Arabella products (cosmetics) and clothes.  

Each one of them has requested a loan for 5,700 lempiras, which makes the group total 17,100 lempiras.

loans.use: to buy clothes and wallets to stock her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruits.

loans.name: Mathews

texts.en:
Mathews lives in the Mombasa area in the coastal province of Kenya. Matthews is married and has five children who are all in school. He has run a transport van ferrying clients’ cargo and goods in the area for one year. His business has offered employment to three other people.

Mathews, who is also employed elsewhere, joined Milango early this year after being invited by a friend. He has applied for a loan of KES 40,000 to help him repair his van. This will enable him to continue serving his clients. He desires to apply for higher loan amounts in future and to purchase other trucks.

loans.use: To repair his van.

loans.name: Johora

texts.en:
Johora has sold mats from the coast of Malindi, Kenya, for the last four years. She also travels to other centers to sell mats. The idea came from the fact that coastal people love to sit on mats during celebrations and for any unofficial meetings. 
She also does salon work from her premises.  She is applying for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to help her add to her stock of mats and also to buy salon materials, such as shampoo, treatments, hair conditioners, etc.
She looks forward to clearing this loan and setting up a durable business premises because the mats business faces the challenge of slow drying during rainy seasons. 
Johora is married and has one child who is in class one, but she is also paying school fees for her younger sister. She believes the income from the two businesses will enable her do this with ease.

loans.use: To purchase mats and salon products

loans.name: Jose Lenin

texts.es: José Lenin de 58 años, se dedica a brindar servicios funerarios y a la elaboración de ataúdes, él ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de su negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de madera, pega, tela, clavos, entre otros productos. De esta manera obtendrá un buen medio ingreso para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: José Lenin, 58, owns a funeral services and coffin manufacturing business.  He has owned the business for several years and he knows what it takes to operate a successful business.  He will use this loan to buy wood, glue, fabric, nails and other supplies that he needs to support the business.  The investment will provide him a way to increase his income.

loans.use: to fund his funeral services and coffin manufacturing business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy alegre y entusiasta. Vive en compañía de su pareja, sus cinco hijos, y de su padre, que por ser mayor de edad depende de Anita para cuidarlo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza Anita es la venta de comida, para lo cual tiene un espacio ambientado en su propia casa, siendo una zona transitada. Cuenta con regular clientela, quienes siempre consumen en su establecimiento. Tiene 2 años dedicándose a esta actividad, asimismo su pareja siempre la ha apoyado en el trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera un ingreso económico, con ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Ahora su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio, así como mejorar los ambientes de su casa. Este sería el crédito número tres con la institución MFP, por tanto se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos y seguir teniendo un buen record crediticio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ingrediente para la preparación de mas comida.
texts.en:
35-year old Anita is a lively, enthusiastic woman. She lives with her partner, their five children, and her elderly father whom she looks after. They live in their own home.

Anita earns her living by selling meals from her home which is in busy part of town. She has a regular customer base who always come to her for their meals. She has done this job for two years. Her partner helps with the work. 

She likes the fact that her job brings in money to pay for household expenses. Her biggest goal now is to expand the business and improve the surroundings. This will be Anita’s third loan with MFP, and she promises to make her repayments punctually so she continues to have a good credit rating. With the money she plans to buy ingredients so she can make more meals.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for meals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new stock of clothes and materials

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been operating a mobile phone repair and accessories shop in Mombasa, Kenya, for the last seven years. He employs two other staff in his business. Besides his business, Patrick is a family man who is married and has one child.   He learned about Milango from other clients who had obtained loans from Milango to improve their businesses. With a loan of Ksh 40,000, he will be able to purchase other repair tools and mobile phone accessories. 
The income obtained from this business will help improve the standard of living of his family and that of his employees.

loans.use: Purchase tools and mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es: José De La Cruz es un joven incansable. Diariamente trabaja de 7 de la mañana a 7 de la noche en su vulcanizadora. Desde hace 17 años está dedicado a esta actividad con la que se ha sostenido. Comenzó cuando no tenía mucha experiencia porque era muy joven pero con el paso del tiempo fue mejorando obtuvo mucha clientela en el lugar donde estaba ubicado. Ahora solicita un crédito con el que pueda comprar llantas, herramientas, suavizantes, entre otros.
texts.en:
José de la Cruz is an industrious individual. He works from 7 in the morning to 7 at night every day in his tire repair shop, a job he’s been doing for 17 years. When he started he didn’t have much experience as he was very young, but as time passed he learned more and now he has many customers.

José is seeking a loan to buy tires, tools, fabric softener etc.

loans.use: to buy tires, fabric softener, tools etc.

loans.name: Lorgia Gabriela

texts.es:
Lorgia Gabriela tiene 23 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con la familia en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Lorgia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es comprarse una finca.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  disfrutar de las festividades en especial las del carnaval.
texts.en:
23-year old Lorgia Gabriela is single and doesn’t have any children. She lives with her family in Chillanes in the province of Bolívar.

There are 21 members in the San José Community Bank which is located in the parish of San José del Tambo, about 60 minutes from the main office. The members work in agriculture growing such crops as maize, bananas, and cocoa.

Lorgia also grows maize, bananas, and cocoa. She buys and sells in the local parish. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, fertilizer, and insecticide to put on her crops. The money will help Lorgia improve her standard of living and the quality of her produce. 

The biggest challenges she faces are competition from other farmers and plant diseases. Her dream is to buy a farm. In her free time, Lorgia enjoys festivities such as carnivals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, fertilizer, and insecticide to put on her crops

loans.name: Pascalia

texts.en:
Pascalia lives in the Coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has one child in primary school. She has been operating a retail shop for four years. 

Pascalia joined Milango in May and is applying for her second loan of KSH 80,000 from Milango. She intends to use the loan to add to her retail stock of milk, sugar, flour, fat etc. She has set her eyes on growing the business and opening a wholesale one in the future. She also operates a garage with her husband and believes this loan will increase their family income and enable them to educate their child and open other feasible business opportunities. She is glad that Milango has continued to provide credit to entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: To buy sugar, bread, flour, fat etc

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 48 años, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus tres hijos y su nieto recién nacido, en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza, es la venta de medicinas a base de vegetales traídos de la amazonía, conocimiento que adquirió de su madre, y ahora ella lo aplica y los vende creándole así un negocio rentable, La preparación la realiza en su casa, y lo hace sola, por lo que ya tiene más de siete años, tiempo que le ha valido para hacerse conocid y tener muchos clientes. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder ayudar a muchas personas en el tratamiento de diversas enfermedades y saber que con su medicina alternativa se han sanado, esto le llena de orgullo. Tiene planes de industrializar su negocio, sabe que para poder lograr eso, se necesita de mucho trabajo y dedicación, y ella está convencida que podrá lograrlo. Este sería el primer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada de poder tener un capital de trabajo para poder atender los pedidos que tiene en espera. Con el préstamo,  comprará plantas medicinales, raíces y cortezas para la preparación de remedios.
texts.en:
Betty, 48, is a woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She lives in her own home with her husband, her three children, and her newborn grandchild.

The work she does is selling medicines based on vegetables brought from the Amazon region.  She acquired this knowledge from her mother, and now she applies the knowledge and sells the medicines, creating a profitable business.  She prepares the medicines in her home and she works alone.  She has been doing this work for more than seven years, time that has been valuable to her for making herself known and getting a lot of customers.

What she likes about her job is being able to help a lot of people in treating various illnesses, and knowing that they have recovered with her alternative medicine.  This fills her with pride.  She is planning to develop her business.  She knows that, to be able to achieve this, she needs lots of work and dedication, and she is convinced that she will be able to do it.

This would be Betty's first loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity offered, to be able to have working capital to be able to deal with the requests that are waiting.

With the loan she will buy medicinal plants, roots, and bark to prepare remedies.

loans.use: to buy herbs, roots, and tree bark.

loans.name: Gloria Libina

texts.es:
Gloria Libina tiene 54 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 18 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Gloria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es llegar a comprar más terreno para sembrar más.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  cocinar y disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Gloria Libina, 54, is married and has a son.  She lives with her husband and 18-year-old son in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Gloria is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  She’s asking for a loan to buy seeds and farm supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain her crops in good condition.

The loan will be of great help for her because she’ll be able to improve her quality of life and her product.  The challenges she faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is to manage to buy more land to plant more.  In her free time she enjoys cooking and enjoying the carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Mirian Maricela

texts.es:
Mirian Maricela tiene 38 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Mirian se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño comprarse una casa que sea propia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar por el campo, es una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Mirian Maricela, 38, is single and has no children.  She lives in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Mirian is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  She’s asking for a loan to buy seeds and farm supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain her crops in good condition.

The loan will be of great help for her because she’ll be able to improve her quality of life and her product.  The challenges she faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is to buy a house of her own.  She enjoys walks in the countryside in her free time and she is a responsible person.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Edgar German

texts.es:
Edgar German tiene 58 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los sobrinos en el cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Edgar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar los productos. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia, vías de comunicación y las plagas. El sueño es ofertar vender productos de buena calidad para obtener mejores ingresos.
Se considera una persona responsable, honrada y le gusta disfrutar del carnaval.
texts.en:
Edgar German, 58, is single and has no children.  He lives with his nephews in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Edgar is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  His purchases and sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  He’s asking for a loan to buy seeds and farm supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain his crops in good condition.

The loan will be of great help for him because he’ll be able to improve his products.  The challenges he faces are very frequent: competition, the roads and pests.  His dream is to have high quality products to sell in order to earn better income.  He considers himself to be a responsible, honest person and he enjoys carnival.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines

loans.name: Norman Alexis

texts.es: Norman de 46 años, se dedica a brindar los servicios notariales y legales. El tiene más de 20 años de ejercer este medio de vida. El estableció una oficina con el fin de obtener ingresos para su hogar, con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado mejorar cada día su actividad. El solicita este crédito para la compra de impresora, papel entre otros, ya que tiene que realizar escritos para que sus clientes tengan una mejor presentación de sus trabajos. Con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Norman, 46, provides legal and notary services.  He’s been working in this profession for over 20 years.  He opened an office in order to earn income for his home.  As time has passed, he’s improved his activity every day.   He asks for this loan to buy a printer and paper, among other things, because he has to prepare written materials so that his customers will present better looking documents and he will earn higher profits and his customers will increase and he will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy a printer and paper.

loans.name: Magner Lindenver

texts.es:
Magner Lindenver tiene 43 años de edad es divorciada tiene un hijo, el vive solo ene l cantón Chillanes provincia de bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Magner se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es que el hijo culmine los estudios.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  escuchar música y pasear por el campo.
texts.en:
Magner Lindenver, 43, is divorced and has a son.  He lives alone in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Magner is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  His purchases and sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  He’s asking for a loan to buy seeds and farm supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain his crops in good condition.

The loan will be of great help for him because he’ll be able to improve his quality of life and his product.  The challenges he faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  His dream is that his son completes his schooling.  He enjoys listening to music and going on excursions through the countryside in his free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Patricia Litamar

texts.es:
Patricia Litamar tiene 23 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Patricia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es comprarse una finca.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  escuchar música y es muy honrada.
texts.en:
Patricia Litamar, 23, is single and has no children.  She lives with her parents in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Patricia is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  She’s asking for a loan to buy seeds and farm supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain her crops in good condition.

The loan will be of great help for her because she’ll be able to improve her quality of life and her product.  The challenges she faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is to buy a farm.  She enjoys listening to music in her free time and she is a very honest person.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia Maria está estudiando administración de empresas, está cursando el quinto año, y el crédito solicitado será para pagar el curso de titulación para obtener el título de su carrera. Sueña con tener su propia empresa y apoyar a los jóvenes que desea superarse y que por falta de empleo no han podido. Le inspira el poder lograr sus metas para superar las necesidades de su familia. Siempre ha sido responsable con sus compromisos, y espera mantener el mismo comportamiento con este crédito
texts.en: Claudia María is studying Business Administration; she’s in the fifth year.  The loan will be to pay for her final course in order to graduate and receive her professional title.  She dreams with having her own firm and to help young adults who want to get ahead but who have been unable to do so because of lack of employment.  She’s inspired to reach her goals to overcome her family’s needs.  She’s always been responsible with her commitments and expects to behave the same way with this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her university courses.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: MatilD. tiene 45 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía D. sus cuatro hijos y su esposo, en su propia casa, la cual logró comprar a base D. mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza MatilD. , es la venta D. pescado fresco y seco. Entonces, desD. muy temprano se levanta para dirigirse al puerto mas cercano, en donD. compra el pescado fresco y lo lleva a su casa, ahí tiene un espacio acondicionado para la venta D. éstos productos. En este negocio, sus hijos la apoyan atendiendo a la clientela, que son muchos. Tiene cuatro años dedicándose a este trabajo, y gracias a ello ha logrado independizarse económicamente, y pueD. contribuir con los gastos D. su hogar y satisfacer las necesidades principales D. sus hijos. Sin embargo el estar en contacto con la humedad le ha traído problemas D. salud, como dolores en los huesos. Considera rentable por la acogida que tiene entre sus vecinos que siempre le compran su producto. Este será el crédito número cinco con la institución MFP, y se siente muy contenta con su grupo, pues lo considera como personas solidarias que se apoyan mutuamente, están siempre en comunicación y toman acuerdos para seguir trabajando unidas. Con el préstamo solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra D. más pescado.
texts.en:
MatilD. is 45 years old; she’s a hardworking woman.  She lives with her four children and her husband in her own house which she managed to buy thanks to much effort.  MatilD. sells fresh and dried fish.  

She rises very early to head to the nearest port to buy fresh fish.  She takes it home where she has a space set asiD. to sell these products.  Her children help her in the business tending to customers, which are quite a few.  

She’s been in this line of work for four years and thanks to it she’s managed to become economically independent and is able to contribute to household expenses and cover her children’s basic needs.  However, being in contact with dampness has caused her some health problems like pain in her bones.  She considers the welcome she has among her neighbors who always buy her products to be profitable.

This will be loan #5 with MFP.  She feels very happy with her group because she considers them to be mutually supportive people who help each other out; they are always in communication and they make decisions to continue to work together.  She will use the requested loan to buy more fish.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Nubia Victoria

texts.es:
Nubia Victoria tiene 41 años de edad es casada tiene una hija, vive con el esposo y con la hija en el Cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Nubia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es que la hija culmine los estudios.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  disfrutar de las festividades.
texts.en:
Nubia Victoria, 41, is married and has a daughter.  She lives with her husband and daughter in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Nubia is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  She’s asking for a loan to buy seeds and farm supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain her crops in good condition.

The loan will be of great help for her because she’ll be able to improve her quality of life and her product.  The challenges she faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is that her daughter completes her schooling.  In her free time she likes to enjoy the festivities.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a Kenyan widowed lady who is 37 years old with three children. Her business is selling second-hand clothes and it's located in a densely populated area. Her customers are passers-by and walk-ins. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She has been doing this business for six years and says her major challenge is financial constraints. Her future dreams are to open another stall and educate her children to university level. Susan describes herself as humble and honest.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Damaris De Los Angeles

texts.es: Damaris está estudiando para ser contadora, está a muy pocos pasos de culminar su carrera, el crédito solicitado será para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera. La culminación de sus estudios ha sido una meta muy grande para ella, ya que en el pasado por falta de recursos económicos se tuvo que retirar, y con mucho esfuerzo por parte de ella y sus padres, pudo regresara a la universidad. Espera en un futuro poder tener su propio negocio, crear una empresa con los conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en: Damaris is studying to be an accountant; she’s very close to finishing her studies.  The requested loan is to pay for her final course.  To complete her studies has been a very big goal of hers because due to lack of economic resources she had to drop out and thanks to much effort on her and her parents’ part she was able to return to the university.  She hopes in future to have her own business and to create a firm with the knowledge she’s acquired.

loans.use: to pay for her courses.

loans.name: Mary Obiero

texts.en:
Mary is a widowed lady aged 51 years. She has four children. She runs a small open restaurant, which is located in a densely populated area. Her customers are passersby, and the business is good during morning hours and the lunch hour. She has done the business for 14 years. She also runs a transport business. 

She requires a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to enable her to add more stock of flour, bread and milk in the business. The challenges she faces include the high cost of food and financial constraints. Her future dream is to have a better future for her family. Mary describes herself as humble, honest and God fearing.

loans.use: To add stock of bread, milk and flour.

loans.name: Mirna Patricia

texts.es: A los 25 años de edad Mirna Patricia ha visto crecer su negocio y al mismo tiempo crecer a sus 2 hijos. Mirna es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta de obtener su medio de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, pues anhela poderle dar educación a sus hijos menores, ya que quiere verlos salir adelante. el motivo del crédito es para la compra bananos, naranjas y mangos. Da gracias a Dios por permitirle acceder al crédito y mejorar las condiciones para realizar su actividad productiva.
texts.en:
At 25 years of age, Mirna Patricia has seen her both her business and her two children grow.  Mirna is a very enterprising woman who enjoys her means of earning a living.  She works selling fruit and vegetables.  She wants to provide her young children with an education, as she wants to see them move ahead in life.

The purpose for this loan is to purchase bananas, oranges and mangoes.  She gives thanks to God for allowing her to receive this loan and improve her work situation.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, oranges, and mangoes.

loans.name: Rosita Marcela

texts.es:
Rosita Marcela tiene 34 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres y hermanos en el Cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Rosita se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad del producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: los intermediarios y las plagas. El sueño es comprar más terreno para tener más producciones.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  disfrutar de las festividades de la localidad.
texts.en:
Rosita Marcela is 34 years old.  She is single with no children, and lives with her parents and siblings in the Chillanes canton in Bolívar province.

The San José community bank is made up of 21 members.  It is located in the parish of San José del Tambo, 60 minutos away from the main office.  This bank's members work in short-term agriculture, such as growing corn, plantains, and cocoa.

Rosita works in agriculture growing corn, plantains and cocoa.  She makes her purchases and sales in the parish of San José del Tambo. She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizers, and weedkiller to keep her crops in good condition.

The loan will be of great help, because she will be able to improve her products' quality.  The challenges that she faces most frequently are dealing with intermediaries and pest infestations.

In her free time she likes to enjoy the local festivals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizers and weedkiller.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a Kenyan married man with one child, and his wife is a farmer. He runs a general shop at civil servant Langata estate in which he sells such items as sugar, flour, beverages and detergents. He targets the residents. He has been running this business for eight years. The challenge he faces is the high cost of commodities. 

He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase the stock of food items, beverages and detergents. His future dream is to purchase a pick-up to help in the running of his business. In the future, he also hopes to buy a plot for farming. He describes himself as very honest, and he has good customer care skills.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, flour and other items.

loans.name: Dina Emerita

texts.es:
Dina Emérita tiene 60 años de edad es viuda no tiene hijos, vive sola en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Dina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es comprarse una finca.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  dedicarse a cuidar las plantas y flores que tiene.
texts.en:
Dina Emérita, 60, is a widow with no children.  She lives alone in Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.

The San José communal bank has 21 members and is located in the parish of San José del Tambo, 60 minutes from the office.  This bank focuses on short-cycle agricultural work growing corn, bananas, and cacao.

Dina works in agriculture, growing corn, bananas, and cacao.  She buys and sells in the parish of San José del Tambo.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Mata Monte herbicide, fertilizer, and weed killer.

The loan will be a big help because she'll be able to improve the quality of her life and of the product.  The challenges she faces frequently are competition and pests.  Her dream is to buy herself a farm.

In her free time she likes to work taking care of the plants and flowers she has.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicide, fertilizer, and weed killer.

loans.name: Elizabeth Adhiambo

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married lady who is 42 years old with two children age 22 and 4 years old. Her husband is a businessman. She runs a second-hand store situated in a slum area, which is a densely populated area. Her customers come from the same area. The loan of KES 20,000 she is requesting will be used to increase her stock of clothes. The challenges she has are the reduced clientele due to harsh economic times and insufficient funds to run her business. Her future dreams are to expand her business to wholesale and to open one or two stores. She is humble and God fearing.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: Milka tiene 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy alegre. Vive en compañía de sus tres hijos a los que quiere mucho y son su motivación para salir adelante. La actividad que realiza Milka es la venta de pescado, para esto cuenta con un pequeño puesto en el mercado informal de Bellavista. Pero sus productos lo consigue en el puerto fluvial de Yarinacocha, que desde muy temprano lo adquiere para luego llevarlo a su puesto de venta. Ha sabido ganarse a su clientela, pues es muy alegre atendiéndolos y eso le ha dado ventaja para sus ventas. Tiene doce años trabajando continuamente y ahora con la ayuda de sus hijos no deja de vender. Ella esta a gusto con su negocio, pues le genera ganancias, que le permite pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Sus hijos son su mayor motivación y le animan a seguir esforzándose. Considera rentable su negocio ya que cuenta con regular clientela que le compran su producto. Este sería el primer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con la oportunidad que le dan, asimismo manifiesta que será puntual en sus pagos para poder acceder a más préstamos futuros. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de más pescado.
texts.en: Milka is 40 years old. She is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives with her three children. She loves them very much and they are her motivation for making progress. Milka has a business selling fish. She has a small stall in the informal Bellavista market. However, she gets her products from Yarinacocha’s river port. She gets these products very early, so can take them to her stall. She has been gaining customers and she is very happy to have them. This has given her an advantage for her sales. She has been continuously working for twelve years. Now, with the help of her children, she hasn’t stopped selling. She is pleased with her business. It generates money that allows Milka to play for her children’s studies. Her children are her main motivation and they encourage her to continue to put in a lot of effort. She considers her business to be profitable now that she has regular customers who buy her products. This will be her first loan with MFP organization. She is happy about the opportunity given to her. She will be punctual with her payments in order to obtain other loans in the future. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of more fish.

loans.use: purchase more fish.

loans.name: Gloria Onorinda

texts.es:
Gloria Onorinda tiene 53 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive en el cantón Chillane Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Gloria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar e incrementar la producción.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia. El sueño comprarse más terrenos.
Se considera un apersona tranquila, trabajadora, puntual, responsable, unida, le gusta caminar y disfrutar del carnaval.
texts.en:
Gloria Onorinda, 53, is single and has no children.  She lives in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Gloria is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to keep her crops in good condition.

The loan will be very helpful because she’ll be able to improve her quality of life and the product.  The challenges she faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is that her son completes his schooling.  In her free time she likes playing sports, especially volleyball, and she is very cooperative.

loans.use: semillas, abonos y fertilizantes

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Barbara” del centro poblado D. Chinumani, distrito, provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene  63  años D. edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos. La señora estudio educación primaria (incompleta).

DesD. hace siete años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta D. chompas, chullos, combinaciones, etc. La señora también se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganados como toros.

Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará lanas D. diferentes colores, la señora nos cuenta que la bolsa D. lana la compra a S/.  150.00 nuevo soles, y las compra D. Juliaca.  Trabaja junto con su esposo y la mercadería la venD. en Ilave, Juli, Yunguyo, también atienD. pedidos.

Su sueño es seguir adelante con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Faustina, 63, is a member of the “Santa Barbara” communal bank in the population settlement of Chinumani, Yunguyo Province and Puno Department.  She’s married and has four children.  She attended elementary school but did not complete it.

She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for seven years.  Her first loan was in the amount of 300 new soles that she invested in her business.  She sells sweaters, knit caps, outfits, etc.  She’s also a cattle merchant, she buys and sells bulls.

She will use her new, 2500 new sol, loan to buy yarn in assorted colors.  She comments that a sack of yarn costs 150 new soles and she buys it in Juliaca.  She works with her husband and she sells her merchandise in Ilave, Juli and Yunguyo and also on order.  Her dream is to stay in business ant improve her income.  What she likes best about her communal bank is the ease of the loans, the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: to buy yarn in assorted colors.

loans.name: Sandra Leticia

texts.es:
Sandra Leticia, de 32 años de edad, tiene 5 años de casada, vive en Tela Atlántida junto a su esposo y un hijo de 3 años de edad. Su esposo es propietario de un autobús de transporte urbano.

Hace dos años  inició un negocio de (pulpería), venta de granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, consomé, especies, cereales, pan, refrescos, productos lácteos, jugos, etc. Ella    es  muy trabajadora,  le dedica 14 horas diarias a este  negocio de donde complementa los ingresos para el hogar.

Este negocio lo estableció con fondos propios del esposo, luego solicitaron un préstamo en ODEF de L.20,000.00 para surtir de mas productos y actualmente solicito un segundo prestamos de L.5,000,.00 a corto plazo también para surtir de productos de granos básicos, refrescos, jugos, pan  y lácteos. 

Su gran sueño es llegar a tener un supermercado ya establecido en un lugar estratégico.
texts.en:
Sandra Leticia is 32 years old, and she has been married for five years.  She lives in Tela Atlántida with her husband and their three year old son.  Her husband owns a bus for urban transportation.

Two years ago she started a business (a grocery store) selling staple foods like rice, sugar, beans, oil, consommé, spices, grains, bread, soft drinks, dairy products, and juices, etc.  She is a very hard-worker.  She spends 14 hours a day on this business, which complements the household income.

She established this business with her own funds from her husband.  Then she requested a loan of 20,000 lempiras from ODEF in order to stock her store with more products.  She is currently requesting a second loan for 5,000 lempiras.  This is also for the short term in order to stock basic grains, soft drinks, juices, bread, and dairy products.

Her big dream is to come to have a supermarket that is well-established in a strategic location.

loans.use: to buy staple foods like rice, sugar, beans, oil, soft drinks, dairy products, and juices, etc.

loans.name: Danilo Hernando

texts.es:
A sus 28 años de edad Danilo es un gran emprendedor, el cual inicio su negocio de venta y reparación de celulares hace ya 6 años.

De dicha actividad genera el ingreso necesario para el sustento de su padre y de su hija de tan solo 3 años de edad.


Con el crédito solicitado, Danilo quiere comprar una vitrina para presentar de mejor manera sus productos al público, al igual que incrementar el numero de celulares y accesorios, sobre todo en esta temporada de fin de año.

El anhela con el tiempo poder abrir un nuevo local y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
At the age of 28, Danilo is a great entrepreneur.  He started his business selling and repairing mobile phones six years ago.  From this business he is able to support his father and his three-year-old daughter.

Danilo will use the requested loan to buy a display case to better exhibit his products to the public and will increase his stock of mobile phones and accessories, especially during this end of year season.  In time, he hopes to open a new locale to generate increased income for his family.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and a display case.

loans.name: Fredick

texts.en: Fredick is a Kenyan man married with two children who are 2 and 10 years old. His wife is a housewife. He runs a business making and selling pans, metal boxes and charcoal banners. His business is located downtown of the city. His customers come from within and outside of Nairobi. He says the business is good and the major challenge he has is insufficient funds. He is using his loan of KES 40,000 to add stock of scrap metal to grow his business. His future desire is to own several business. He is determined and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap metal

loans.name: Leonardo Alejandro

texts.es: Leonardo está estudiando Banca y Finanzas, el crédito será usado para pagar los móudulos del curso de titulación, el está pagando sus estudios con los ingresos obtenidos de su trabajo. Dentro de algunos años se ve trabajando en alguna institución financiera y adquiriendo experiencia para siempre seguir mejorando. Le inspiran a seguir adelante su familia y su hijo, porque desea darle una mejor calidad de vida. Agradece de antemano por la ayuda que puedan darle, y se siente con la plena capacidad de poder cumplir con el compromiso que está adquiriendo
texts.en: Leonardo is studying Banking and Finance.  The loan will be used to pay fees for his final course.  He has been paying for his courses with income earned at his job.  He sees himself working for a financial institution in a few years acquiring experience to always continue improving.  His family and his son inspire him to continue forward because he wants to provide a better quality of life.  He thanks you ahead of time for any help you might give him.  He feels fully capable of meeting the commitment he’s taking on.

loans.use: to pay fees for his final courses.

loans.name: Doris Guadalupe

texts.es:
Doris es una joven de 28 años de edad, soltera, vive junto a sus padres, de profesion contadora siendo su trabajo hoy en dia, pues al iniciar comenzo como cajera y  alcanzo el puesto de contador, mejorando sus ingresos.
Como meta, ahora que esta, ganando su dinero, es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, en donde hara la pared de los cuartos de concreto, siendo de madera muy vieja, mejorando esta condicion , al hacer paredes de concreto. materiales a comprar, piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, y otros. Lo que gozara de privacidad y mejor seguridad al tener una mejor vivienda para sus padres.
texts.en:
Doris is a young 28-year old who lives with her parents. She is an accountant; she started off as a teller and then obtained the position of accountant, with a subsequent increase in income.
Her goal, now that she is making her own income, is to improve her home's infrastructure. She will put up concrete walls; right now they are wooden and very old. This will improve her home's conditions. She will need to purchase stone, sand, cement, iron, and other items. She will be able to enjoy privacy and better security, and give her parents a better home.

loans.use: to build concrete room divisions, thus improving her conditions and providing more privacy and security.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en: Roselyne is a 37-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 10 years old. She describes herself as polite, welcoming, and ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, detergents etc. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre and her primary customers are the local people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to increase her stock of general items. Her business goal is to grow into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be polite, welcoming, and ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, detergents etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre and her primary customers are the local people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her stock of items. Her business goal is to grow into wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To add to her stock of items

loans.name: Urginia

texts.es:
Urginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del, distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.  Cuenta con estudios superiores.

Desde hace dos años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de bayetas (telas).

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará 12 kilos de lana de diferentes colores, quince metros de bayeta y algunos materiales para construir su casa como yeso, cemento.  La artesanía la vende en Puno y Juli.
Ella cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja en una Institución de la zona.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las charlas y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Urginia is a member of the “Aymaras Juli II” communal bank in Juli District, Chucuito Province and Puno Department.  She’s 40 years old, married and has three children.  She completed higher education.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in the purchase of baize (fabric).

She will use this new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy 12 kilos of yarn in different colors and 15 meters of baize as well as some building materials and supplies like plaster and cement.  She sells her crafts in Puno and Juli.  Her husband, who works for a local institution, helps her out.  Her dream is that her children become professionals.  What she enjoys the most about her communal bank is the talks and the meetings.

loans.use: to buy twelve kilos of yarn in assorted colors and fifteen meters of baize.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 49 años, es una mujer alegre, trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo y de sus dos hijas y su nieto, en su casa propia. Ella cuida de su nieto mientras su hija sale a atrabajar. La actividad que realiza Maria, es la venta de abarrotes en general, para lo cual abrió una bodega en su casa. Es así que cada día atiende a su clientela. tiene dos años dedicándose a esta actividad, y gracias a ello ha logrado contribuir con los gastos de la familia. Por otro lado, manifiesta que le conviene este trabajo ya que puede disponer de su tiempo para dedicarse a su nieto. Su plana es seguir creciendo su negocio, sabe que para esto tiene que tener más capital. Este sería el crédito número dos con la institución MFP, se siente de saber que contará con su ayuda y por ello desea cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el préstamo solicitado, lo invertirá para comprar productos para implementar su bodega.
texts.en:
María, 49, is a cheerful, hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband, two daughters and grandson in her own house.  She takes care of her grandson while her daughter is at work. 

María sells groceries in general; she opened a store at home to do so.  She tends to her customers every day.  She’s been in business two years and thanks to it has been able to help cover family expenses.  She also states that this business is convenient because she’s able to have time to dedicate to her grandson.  Her plan is to continue expanding the business.  She knows that to do so she needs more capital.

This will be loan #2 with MFP.  She knows that she can count on your help and wishes to make her installment payments.  She will use the requested funds to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en: Sylvester is a 47-year-old married man. He has 5 children ranging from 10 and 24 years. He describes himself  as polite, welcoming, and ambitious man. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, detergents etc. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are the local people. His business challenge is insufficient funds. He will use the loan Kes 20,000 to increase his stock of items. His business goal is to grow into wholesale within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children up to the university level.

loans.use: To increase his stock of items

loans.name: Isaac Aura

texts.en: Isaac is a 50-year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 20 years to 28 years. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, detergents etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a shopping centre and his primary customers are the local people. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to increase his stock of items. His business goal is to grow into wholesale within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: George Kimori

texts.en: George is a 56-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. He describes himself to be innovative and generous. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, detergents, etc. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a shopping center and his primary customers are the local people. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. He will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to increase stock of general items. His business goal is to grow it into a wholesale one within five years.

loans.use: To add stock of general items.

loans.name: Everth Omar

texts.es: Everth Omar tiene 42 años, su actividad es una pulpería. El es una persona emprendedora que disfruta de negocio. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que se siente muy contento, es un hombre emprendedor dispuesto a trabajar duro para alcanzar sus objetivos, le gusta estar adelante de la competencia, el piensa que para poder ascender a una meta la mejor fórmula es superarnos constantemente fue así que decidió realizar este crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, pan, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Eveth tiene la confianza que con su esfuerzo y dedicación lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Everth Omar is 42 years old and has a grocery store.  He’s an enterprising person who enjoys business.  This is not his first loan request and he feels very happy.  He’s an enterprising man who is willing to work hard to reach his goals.  He likes to be ahead of the competition and thinks that in order to reach a goal the best formula is to constantly improve ourselves.  This is how he decided to take out this loan that will allow him to buy snacks, soft-drinks, basic grains, bread and beverages, among other products.  Everth trusts that with his effort and dedication he’ll manage to bring economic security to his home and an improved quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Samson Otieno

texts.en: Samson is a 23-year-old single man. He describes himself to be kind, honest, and motivated. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, detergents etc. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are the local people. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to increase his stock of items. His business goal is to grow into wholesale within 5 years.

loans.use: To increase his stock of items

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos, cuatro de ellos son independientes.  Tiene estudios de educación primaria.
	
Trabaja desde hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artesanías y bordados en bayeta.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles comprará bayetas, lanas y cien cojines panorámicas.  La señora trabaja sola en su negocio,  su esposo es agricultor.

Irene desea seguir trabajando y mejorar sus ganancias.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la alegría la distracción con las socias.
texts.en:
Irene’s a member of the “Aymaras Juli II” communal bank in Juli District, Chucuito Province and Puno Department.  She’s 46 years old, married and has six children, four of them are independent.  She completed elementary school.

She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her crafts and embroidered 
baize business.

She will use this new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy baize, yarn and 100 scenic cushions.  She works alone in her business; her husband’s a farmer.

Irene wants to stay in business and improve her profits.  What she enjoys about her communal bank is the joy and amusement of her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy baize, yarn and 100 scenic cushions.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Tiempo De Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Doña  Anais es una de las integrantes del Banco Mujer Tiempo de Esperanza, tiene 40 años de edad,  es madre de 2 hijos, uno de 16 y otro de 20 años,  es madre sola y jefa de hogar,  vive únicamente con sus hijos ya que su esposo los abandonó hace algunos años. Ella ha trabajado muy fuerte para mantener a sus hijos y darles los estudios, por eso ve en los créditos de Fundación Mujer una ayuda para iniciar su proyecto de crianza de cerdos, generando así ingresos adicionales además de su trabajo ocasional en una finca bananera, percibiendo un salario muy bajo.  
Ella ha hecho un plan de trabajo en el que involucra a sus hijos para realizar las labores domesticas, cumplir con su horario de trabajo e iniciar su proyecto de Porcicultura. 
Tiene muchas metas y deseos de superación, pero una de las cosas más importantes para ella es poder  brindarles estudio a sus hijos, y tener un negocio propio para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y sus familias.
texts.en:
Anais is one of the members of the “Mujer Tiempo de Esperanza” communal bank.  She’s 40 years old and the mother of two children, a 16-year-old and a 20-year-old.  She’s a single mother and head of household.  She only lives with her two children because her husband abandoned them some years ago.  She has worked very hard to support her children and provide them with schooling.  This is why she sees loans from Fundación Mujer as a help to start a pig raising business generating additional income to what she earns as an part-time worker at a banana plantation which is a very low salary.

She has developed a work plan that involves her children in doing the domestic chores so she can fulfill her job requirements and start her pig raising project.  She has many goals and a strong desire to improve but one of the most important things for her is to be able to provide an education for her children and to have a business of her own to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Solidario Lleno De Gracia 2 Group

texts.es:
Solidario Lleno de gracia 2.
este grupo esta formado por 3 señoras las cuales esta doña florinda.de 39 años de edad.ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario,desde hace 10 años y le da gracias a Dios porque le dio la oportunidad de obtener su negocio, y asi generar ingresos que le ayudan a su familia,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de consumo diario,ya que nececita surtir mas su negocio,al igual que las siguientes socias estan solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la venta,ellas esperan que fape les pueda dar el apoyo que nececitan para salir delante.
texts.en: Solidarity Full of Grace 2 s a group made up of 3 ladies including Florinda, 39 years old.  She has sold everyday products for 10 years and thanks God for giving her the opportunity to start her business and generate income to help her family.  She requests the loan to buy everyday products to better stock her business, just as her partners request a loan to buy merchandise for sale.  They hope that FAPE will be able to give them the support they need to move forward.

loans.use: buy everyday products for sale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 44-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be neat and patient. She operates a grocery store where she sells kale, onions, tomatoes, cabbages and other green vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are restaurants. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 20,0000 Kenyan shilling loan to increase stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to grow it into a wholesale one within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow the business and construct a permanent premises where she will be able to run her business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio de 56 años de edad tiene en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, en una zona muy comercial una farmacia; este negocio crece cada día más y debe  comprar medicamentos permanentemente para poder responder a la creciente demanda.  Con sus años de experiencia está muy seguro   que invirtiéndole y haciendo compras de contado es mucho más competitivo y esto es justamente lo  que planea con su credikiva,  , para  poner en marcha su plan de crecimiento. Cuando inició su negocio primero se capacitó en el SENA,  Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje y trabajó más de 20 años en hospitales de la ciudad. Inicialmente emprendió este negocio, en  un municipio muy cercano a Barranquilla,  en sociedad con un amigo y así estuvo durante 38 años alternando  su trabajo con el negocio del hospital. Hace 20 años estuvo  vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en un grupo solidario. En su negocio presta los servicios de inyectología, toma de presión y terapias respiratorias, en la actualidad es apoyado por su esposa quien también es enfermera  y desde hace 4 años el negocio opera en un local de su vivienda y se independizó por completo y esto los hace muy feliz. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que recibe después de haber suspendido sus créditos de grupos solidarios con la FMSD.  A  esta organización agradece el tener un equipo importante para ofrecer servicios de terapia. Su meta es continuar mejorando su negocio pues esto le apoyo en la generación de bienestar de su familia. Con su credikiva comprará medicamentos de contado y en mayor cantidad para ahorrar costos y obtener buenos descuentos, lo que hace que su inversión sea muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Julio, 56, has a pharmacy in the center of the city of Barranquilla and in a very commercial area. This business grows more each day, and Julio has to constantly buy medicine to be able to meet the increasing demand. With his years of experience, he is very sure that investing and having cash on-hand makes him much more competitive, and this is exactly what he plans to do with his Kiva loan in order to implement his plan for growth.

When he began his first business he was trained by SENA, Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje (National Apprenticeship Service), and he worked for more than 20 years in hospitals in the city. Initially, he launched this business in partnership with a friend and in a town very close to Barranquilla. For 38 years he alternated his work and the hospital’s business. 20 years ago he partnered with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through a communal bank. In his business, Julio provides hypodermic syringes, takes blood pressure, and offers respiratory therapies, and he is now helped by his wife who is also a nurse. For four years he’s been running his business out of a shop in his home, and he is completely independent which makes him very happy. 

This Kiva loan is his second after having finished his communal bank loan through FMSD. He is thankful to this organization for having important equipment to offer respiratory therapy. His goal is to continue improving his business as this will help him provide for the well-being of his family. With his Kiva loan, he will buy medicine in cash and in greater quantity in order to save money and get better prices, making his investment very successful.

loans.use: to buy medicines in cash and in greater quantity to save money and get better prices.

loans.name: Henry Ismael

texts.es: El Señor Henry Ismael es un hombre trabajador, luchador con ganas de prosperar y sacar adelante a toda su familia, su negocio es la venta de ropa, desde hace mas de 3 años que tiene este negocio, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante para proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, ropa interior, entre otros. Sus principales sueños y metas del es mejorar su seguridad y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Henry Ismael is a hard-working man, striving with dreams of prosperity and success for all of his family. His business is selling clothing, and he’s had this business for more than three years. He’s a young man who really wants to get ahead so that he can give his family what they need. The purpose of the loan is to buy pants, blouses, skirts, suits, underwear, and other things. His main dreams and goals are to improve his security and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, suits, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a 34-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be ambitious and honest. She operates a grocery store where she sells kale, onions, tomatoes, cabbages and other green vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are restaurants. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to increase stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to grow it into a wholesale one within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow the business and construct a permanent premises where she will be able to run her business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Geoconda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Geoconda  hoy en dia, esta laborando en Zona Franca, teniendo un salario fijo, pues  siempre vende ropa por encargo a sus compañeros de trabajo, logrando mantener ese otro ingreso. Busca trabajo ya que las ventas estaban bajas, la canasta basica aumento en su totalidad.
Su esposo sigue trabajando de ebanista, y sus dos hijos terminando el curso escolar.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento, podra cambiar el techo de su vivienda, que esta en malas condiciones, y por tal razon comprara, laminas de zinc, cuartones de madera, clavos para cambiarlo. Geoconda esta contenta ya que es atraves de estos prestamos ha mejorado el ochenta por ciento su vivienda, siendo  favorable, pudiendo equilibrar sus gastos junto a su esposo, Lo que le permite cumplir con sus compromiso de pago y gastos personales.
texts.en: Geoconda currently works in the Free Trade Zone and has a fixed salary. She always sells made-to-order clothes to her colleagues at work, thus obtaining additional income.  She is looking for work since sales are slow and grocery prices have risen in general.  Her husband continues working as a cabinet maker, and her two children are finishing the school year.  Today with this new financing, she will be able to change the roof on her home, which is in poor condition.  For that reason she will buy zinc laminate, wood, and nails in order to replace the roof.  Geoconda is happy since because of these loans she has improved eighty percent of her home.  With all things favorable, she has been balancing her expenses, along with her husband, which permits her to fulfill her payment obligations as well as her personal expenses.

loans.use: To purchase zinc laminate, wood, and nails in order to replace the roof of her home

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 25-year-old married man. He describes himself to be ambitious and patient. He operates a grocery store where he sells kale, onions, tomatoes, cabbages and other green vegetables. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a busy market and his primary customers are restaurants. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to increase his stock of vegetables. His business goal is to grow it into wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will grow the business and construct a permanent premise where he will be able to run his business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: David
