texts.es: David tiene 33 años, es un joven amable y emprendedor. Vive en compañía de su esposa y de su pequeña hija, además de dos hermanas y tres sobrinos, en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza David es la digitación de documentos en computadora. Paralelo a ello trabaja también ofreciendo el servicio de transporte en mototaxi, el cual posee uno y que logró comprarlo con sus ahorros. Lleva dedicandose a ambas actividades desde hace siete años, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho solo. Él se siente a gusto con lo que hace, ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico y gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio de digitación, pues desea ofrecer el servicio de escanear fotos, ya que por la zona por donde vive es el único que brinda éste servicio. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, y por tanto se siente muy bien con su grupo comunal, pues los considera como personas responsables y cumplidoras con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará un scanner nuevo y repuestos para su mototaxi.
texts.en: David, 33, is an enterprising and friendly young man. He lives with his wife and their small daughter, along with two sisters and three cousins, in their own home. The work that David does is typing documents into the computer. At the same time, he also offers transportation services on his moto-taxi, which he was able to buy with his savings. He gets up to work these jobs at seven in the morning, and at the moment he works alone. He is happy with what he is doing since it allows him to have an income and, thanks to that, he can cover the household costs. He has plans to expand his typing business as he’d like to offer photo-scanning services since, in the area where he lives, he’s the only business that offers that services. This will be his second loan with MFP, and he feels very happy with his communal bank as he considers the members to be responsible and compliant with the payment of their loans. He will buy a new scanner and pay for repairs to his moto-taxi with the loan he’s asked for.

loans.use: to buy a scanner and to pay for repairs to his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 26-year-old single man. He has one child. He describes himself as diligent. He operates a clothing sales business where he sells clothes to the local people. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to increase his stock of clothes. His business goal is to grow it into wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will grow the business and open other stalls in other areas.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Fredrick Osore

texts.en: Fredrick is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself to be a visionary. He operates a clothing sales business where he sells clothes to the local people. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenges to be poor road networks, inflation, and seasonality. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase his stock of clothes. His business goal is to grow it into wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will grow the business and buy a van to facilitate the running of the business.

loans.use: To increase his stock of clothes

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: José Roberto se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace más de 6 años que tiene de poseer este medio de vida. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de  pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos, ropa para niños. Todos los días comienza este negocio desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar variedad en productos. El propósito de José es seguir progresando con su negocio y ser un buen cliente para otros préstamos futuros y poder ir al día con la cuota.
texts.en:
José Roberto sells clothing. This has been his livelihood for more than six years. The purpose of the loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, dresses, and children's clothing. 

He works in his business everyday from 7:00 in the morning to 7:00 in the evening, so the majority of his customers come to him to buy a variety of products. 

Jose's intention is to continue moving forward with his business, to be a good client for other future loans, and to be up to date with his instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, dresses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 43-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from five years to twenty years. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a clothing sales business where she sells clothes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonality. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase clothes to sell. Her business goal is to grow it into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow the business, buy a plot of land, and build rental units.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Sapenzia Kasiala

texts.en: Sapenzia is a 63-year-old married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 30 to 40 years. She describes herself to be polite, patient, and ambitious. She operates a clothing sales business where she sells clothes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 25 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenges to be seasonality and price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to increase her stock of clothes. Her business goal is to grow it into wholesale within five years.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suite, dresses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Ledys

texts.es: La señora Ledys D. 51 años D. edad es madre D. 4 hijos en las edades D. 26 a 31 años D. edad. Ella tiene un taller D. confecciones en su barrio donD. elabora especialmente ropa femenina e infantil a todo costo, para ello posee los equipos y maquinarias básicas que ayudan al buen funcionamiento D. la microempresa; sus clientes son principalmente vecinos del barrio donD. resiD. y D. los conjuntos residenciales que hay a su alrededor.  El acabado D. sus productos es catalogado por su clientela como excelente y esto hace que se mantenga muy cerca D. Ledys. Cuenta con gran experiencia en el negocio. Sus ventas mensuales le generan un buen margen D. rentabilidad lo que le  permite aportar a los gastos D. su hogar, posee otros ingresos por concepto D. venta D. productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogo;  en la actualidad se prepara para fortalecer sus ventas en los meses D. Noviembre y Diciembre, épocas en las que usualmente repuntas. Esta es  la razón por la cual acuD. a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  materias primas para confeccionar ropa infantil encargada y poder responder a su creciente clientela.
texts.en: Ledys is 51 years old and is the mother of four children aged 26 to 31 years old. She has a clothing workshop in her neighborhood where she mostly makes women’s and children’s clothes of all prices. To do this, she has equipment and basic machines that aid in the smooth operation of her small business. Her clients are mainly neighbors in the area where she lives and in the surrounding residential neighborhoods. Her clients find her final products to be excellent, and this keeps them returning to Ledys.  She has a lot of experience in business. Her monthly sales generate a good profit which allows her to contribute to the household expenses. She has other forms of income from the sale of products through catalogues and reference books. Currently she is getting ready to increase her sales in the November and December, times in which sales are usually high. This is the reason she is asking for a Kiva loan, first financed through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy raw materials to make commissioned children’s clothing and to be able to meet growing demand.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make commissioned children's clothing

loans.name: Lucy Nyawira

texts.en: Lucy is a 26-year-old woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a clothing sales business where she sells socks to the local people. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy socks. Her business goal is to grow it into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will add different types of clothing to her stock.

loans.use: To buy socks

loans.name: Merceline Neema

texts.en:
Merceline is a 37 year old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a a tailoring services business where she makes and sells clothes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenges to be inflation and seasonality. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her stock of material. Her business goal is to expand it within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will put up rental units to make more income.

loans.use: To purchase more material

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making traditional fabrics

loans.name: Mbulu

texts.en:
Mbulu is a 29 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. He describes himself to be jovial, responsible, and accountable. 

He operates a a tailoring services business where he makes and sells clothes to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase his stock of material. His business goal is to open another tailoring services business in a different town within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will put up a permanent premises for running the business instead of renting.

loans.use: To purchase more material

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina desde más 8 años que tiene este negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos. En donde tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que le solicitan variedad en sus productos. Cuenta con una clientela establecida, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus necesidades de su casa. Maria se ha dado cuenta que su negocio va creciendo favorablemente en el transcurso de los días. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de queso, cuajada, crema entre otros.
texts.en: Maria Cristina has had her business for more than eight years. She sells dairy products. She has a lot of clients who ask for a variety of products. She has an established clientele, and with the income she gets she will be able to afford household necessities. Maria has realized that her business will grow favorably over time. She would like to continue growing her business with the purchase of more merchandise. The purpose of the loan is to buy cheese, curd, cream, and other dairy products.

loans.use: to buy cheese, curd, cream, and other dairy products.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Martha vive al suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 13 a 22 años.  Ella propietaria de una tienda en el barrio La Pradera, desde hace un poco más de 3 años. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la vivienda de  sus padres;  posee toda la infraestructura necesaria para buen funcionamiento de este tipo de actividad y en este  sector  maneja una baja la competencia;  tiene un muy buen nivel de ventas y un surtido con variedad y calidad. Sus inventarios adecuados, y su cartera o cuentas por cobrar las maneja con mucha precaución. El margen de rentabilidad de su negocio, le permite tener una buena capacidad de pago, las rotaciones tanto de cartera como de inventarios son agiles. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva con el cual surtirá la microempresa  con productos para la temporada de fin de año, pues planea provisionarse para afrontar los aumentos de los precios que normalmente son en el mes de Enero.  Su sueño es lograr una educación de calidad para sus hijos esperando que ellos sean profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Martha lives in the southwest part of the city with her partner and her four children, ages 13 to 22.  She has owned a store in the La Pradera neighborhood for a little more than three years. 

Her business is located in her parent's house. She has all the infrastructure necessary for operating this kind of business well; and competition in this part of the city is declining.  She has a very good sales volume and a varied, high quality selection.  She has adequate inventories, and manages her accounts payable cautiously. The profit margin of her business allows her to have a good ability to pay. Turnover of both accounts payable and inventory is rapid.

Currently she is applying for her first Credikiva loan, in order to stock her convenience store with products for the end of year season. She plans to stock up in order to cope with the price increases that generally occur in the month of January. Her dream is to provide a quality education to her children, hoping that they will become successful professionals.

loans.use: To supply her convenience store with products for the end of year season.

loans.name: Joseph Ndile

texts.en: Joseph is a 35 year old married man. He has four children between the ages of one and 12 years-old. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a business selling cereals like maize, beans and others to the local people. He has been involved in this business for six years and employs two staff members. His business is located in a shopping centre. Joseph describes his biggest business challenges to be inflation and seasonality. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to increase his stock of cereals. His business goal is to grow into wholesale operation within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a van to facilitate in the running of the business.

loans.use: to increase his stock of cereals

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 42 year old man. He has three children between the ages of 12 and 18 years old. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a butcher shop, a business that he has been involved in for four years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenges to be inflation and insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to purchase goats and sheep which will be slaughtered for meat. His business goal is to grow into a wholesale operation within five years. In the future, he hopes to become a supplier of meat to various institutions.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep

loans.name: G.s. Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es: Margarita Del Socorro tiene 32 años es soltera madre de dos hijos menores de edad que están estudiando en primaria. Ella solicito un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio ha permitido tener mayores ganancias. Su mayor obstáculo ha sido principalmente enfermedades de sus hijos. El préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de calzado, cosméticos ropa en general entre otros. Desea continuar creciendo principalmente en cantidad de clientes y en el futuro realizara mejoras a su vivienda. La señora Marisol tiene 42 años es casada, su esposo es agricultor. Ella solicito un crédito de venta de gallinas y huevos.  Afirma que su negocio ha logrado crecer ya que esta ofertando otra variedad de productos de gallinas. Su mayor obstáculo es la falta de capital de trabajo grande que permita incrementar mas el inventario.
texts.en: Margarita Del Socorro is 32 years old. She is a single mother of two young children. Her children are in primary school. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business in order earn greater profits. Her biggest obstacle has primarily been her children’s illnesses. The loan will be invested in the purchase of shoes, cosmetics, clothing and other things. She wants to continue growing the number of customers she has. In the future, she will make improvements to her home. Marisol is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer. She is requesting a loan for selling chickens and eggs. She states that her business has been growing now that she is offering other types of chicken products. Her biggest obstacle is the lack of working capital that would allow her to increase her inventory.

loans.use: purchase shoes, cosmetics, clothing and other items.

loans.name: Celia Pastora

texts.es:
Doña Celia sigue con su negocio de pulperia,  en donde ha venido aumentando sus ventas, esto lograndolo con financiamiento que Afodenic,  ah otorgado, en todos estos años, ah ocupado parte de su sala, teniendo poco espacio para compartir con su familia, pero que ha sido para el bien comun de todos.
Su esposo sigue apoyando y ejerciendo su trabajo de taxi,  y sus hijos, cursando el año escolar, ya tiene un comienzo de la construccion, lo que con este nuevo prestamo comprara materiales de construccion  para terminar de cerrar el local,  donde sera la pulperia.Teniendo mejor comodidad, espacio, dando un mejor servicio  a sus clientes y  a su familia con este nuevo local.
texts.en: Celia continues with her local store and her sales have been growing because of the financial loans she has been granted in all these years from Kiva field partner Afodenic.  The business has occupied part of her living room, leaving little space to share with her family, but it has been for the common good of everyone.  Her husband continues helping and working as a taxi driver, and her children continue with their schooling.  She has a start on the construction, and with this new loan she will buy construction materials in order to finish the enclosure for the annex on her home that will serve as her business and offer more comfort, space and better service for her clients and her family.

loans.use: To finish constructing an annex for her local store, offering better service to her clients.

loans.name: Wangeci

texts.en: Wangeci is a 52 year old married woman. She has three children between the ages of 22 and 31 years old. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a local restaurant. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to purchase more seats and tables for her restaurant. Her business goal is to grow it into a big restaurant that will be serving more customers within five years.

loans.use: to purchase seats and tables

loans.name: Sarah Mugure

texts.en: Sarah is a 31 year old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be friendly. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair and beauty services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a shopping centre and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase more hair relaxers, shampoos and other cosmetics. Her business goal is to grow it into a spa within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a plot of land where she will build a residential home.

loans.use: to purchase hair relaxers, shampoos and other cosmetics

loans.name: G.s. La Chiripa Group

texts.es: El señor Evelio tiene 38 años es casado y tiene una hija de 16 años de edad. El señor se dedica a la venta de productos derivados del maíz, tal como atol, chicha de maíz, cosa de horno y elabora nacatamales los fines de semana. Solicita este crédito para la compra de maíz, pinol entre otros. Su mayor problema ha sido siempre el estar comprando poco a poco ya que los precios son más caros que comprar al por mayor. Tiene 5 años de tener este negocio, el cual dio inicio debido a la falta de empleo, lo que lo obligo a buscar una alternativa para mantener a la familia. La señora Guillermina Justa es tiene 60 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos pero todos son mayores de edad y viven aparte. Ella se dedica a la venta de leña, pan y nacatamales al por mayor y al detalle, su negocio lo tiene localizado en su casa de habitación y también sale a vender de manera ambulante.  Cabe señalarse ella tiene ya ocho años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual empezó con ayuda de sus hijos para ganarme mi propio dinero y no estar siempre dependiendo de otros.
texts.en:
Evelio is 38 years old, married, and has a sixteen year old daughter. He sells products derived from corn, such as atol (a thick, corn-based drink served warm), chicha (an alcoholic beverage made from fermented corn), and baked goods. On the weekend he makes nacatamales (steamed meat and vegetable pasties, cooked in corn leaves). He has been in this business for five years, which he started because he was unemployed and needed an alternative to support his family. 

He is asking for this loan in order to buy corn and corn flour, among other things. His biggest problem has always been buying little by little, which is more expensive compared to buying wholesale. 

Guillermina Justa is 60 years old, married and has six children, though they are all adults and live on their own. She sells firewood, bread and nacatamales wholesale and retail. Her business is located in her home, but she also sells door to door. Guillermina Justa has distinguished herself by her eight years of experience in this business, which she started with the help of her children. She wanted to earn her own money and not always be dependent on others.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, etc.

loans.name: Aries (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela Las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las 10 sociss y 1 socio  del Banco Comunal Aries. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

Aquí conocimos a Suleyka, tiene 19 años  de edad, está soltera y estudia el tercer semestre de Auditoria en una Universidad de Manabí. Ella vive en la casa de una hermana.

La señorita Suleyka para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos poder solventar sus gastos de educación y personales se dedica en sus ratos libres a la venta de productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para dama), también trabaja en una oficina de encomiendas a nivel nacional, allí trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Realiza sus ventas en la universidad donde estudia en sus ratos libres, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Lo que más vende son los perfumes.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar perfumes, cosméticos, cremas y bisutería. 

Su sueño es terminar  sus estudios y ejercer su profesión. 

Las dos fotos pequeñas adjuntas son de un socio y una socia que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In the old fortress “Las Orquedeas” (The Orchids) in the city of Portoviejo, the 10 female and 1 male members of the Aries Communal Bank meet every 15 days. They dedicate themselves to diverse activities including general commerce and services among other things. They united in order to gain access to benefits offered by the Espoir Foundation. This is the first loan cycle for their communal bank and they hope to comply fully in order to continue forward with the institution.

Here we get to know Sulayka, who is 19 years old, single, and studying in her 3rd semester at the University of Manabi. She lives in her sister's house.

In her spare time, Suleyka sells Yanbal products (beauty articles, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies accessories), to pay for her education and personal expenses. She also works in a national postal office from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. She makes her sales in the university where she studies during her free time. Sulayka sells on credit and collects weekly. She has done this for a year and it is going very well. Perfumes are her best sellers.

Sulayka will use this loan to buy perfumes, cosmetics, creams, and ladies jewelry. Her dream is to finish her studies and exercise her profession.

The 2 accompanying small photos are of a male and a female member who because of their work could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and  costume jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda es una madre soltera de 42 años de edad, por problemas de incompatibilidad se separó de su pareja, quién se encarga de enviarle el dinero que por ley le corresponde a Anaid, su hija de 2 años. Ella y su hija viven en una casa propia en el distrito de Tarma. Por las grandes extensiones de terrenos con los que cuenta, ella se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra una variedad de productos como: papas, olluco, habas, avena, alfalfa, etc., “me conviene sembrar de todo, la papa por ejemplo se cosecha una vez al año, y se gana bien, mientras que la alfalfa, el olluco, las habas, me dan sustento para los otros meses”, explica. A la vez, con la alfalfa que siembra, alimenta a sus vacas y cuyes. 
En su barrio, además se encarga de vender la leche que sus vacas producen, así también ofrece leña por arrobas, las que expende al por mayor, de esa manera, obtiene ingresos de varias maneras. Comenta que, la producción de sus terrenos se debe a la buena inversión que destina a la compra de abonos, muchas veces tuvo que enfrentarse con la “gusanera” (plaga que carcome las papas y ollucos), por no comprar los insecticidas y fertilizantes necesarios. En sus labores recibe el apoyo de personal ajeno, al que paga diariamente. Hermelinda espera brindarle una buena educación a su pequeña Anaid, para ello seguirá trabajando igual o más que ahora. Mediante su ayuda, Hermelinda podrá acceder a su primer préstamo de MFP, por esa razón muestra firmeza al comunicar que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero del préstamo, esta abnegada madre podrá mejorar su calidad de vida, acondicionando un piso de cemento a su casa rústica, en ello invertirá 1500 soles. Así también destinará lo restante en la compra de abonos orgánicos para sus sembríos de papas.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a 42 year old single mom who for problems of incompatability separated from her partner who continues to send her the money that by law is due to Anaid, her two year old daughter.  She and her daughter live in their own home in the district of Tarma.  Because she has large tracts of land, Hermelinda works in agriculture.  She plants a variety of products including potatoes, olluco (another tuber), broad beans, oats, alfalfa, etc.  "It's useful to plant everything.  Potatoes, for example, are harvested once a year and sell well, while alfalfa, olluco and broad beans feed me for the other months," she explains.  At the same time, with the alfalfa that she plants, she feeds her cows and guinea pigs.  

In her neighborhood, besides selling the milk that her cows produce, she also offers firewood by weight which she sells in bulk.  In this way, she earns income in various manners.  She comments that the production of her fields is due to the good investment she makes in the purchase of fertilizers.  Many times she has had to confront the "worms" (a plague that eats through potatoes and other tubers) because she has not purchased the necessary insecticides and fertilizers.  In her work she receives help from outside laborers, who she pays daily.  Hermelinda hopes to provide a good education for her young Anaid, and for that reason she continues working as much or more now.  With your help, Hermelinda will be able to access her first loan from Kiva partner MFP, and for that reason she communicates firmly that she will be punctual in the payment of her debts.  With the money from the loan, this selfless mother will be able to improve her quality of life, creating a cement floor for her rustic house, and investing 1500 Peruvian soles in that endeavor.  The rest of the money she will use for the purchase of organic fertilizers for her potato fields.

loans.use: To buy cement to put a floor in her house, and to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Abedon

texts.es: José Abedon tiene 37 años, es casado pero tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. José es un hombre con mucha visión de por medio. Desde que empezó y hasta ahora continúa ejerciendo su actividad que es brindar el servicio de moto taxi, trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, ha sido con el paso del tiempo que ha logrado ampliarse cada día más.  Para el futuro, anhela tener otra moto taxi para generar más ingresos a su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de llantas, combustible y realizarle ciertas mejoras a su moto taxi.
texts.en: José Abedon is 37 years old, married, and has two young children in his care.  José is a man with much vision, for good measure.  Since he began and up to now he continues his work which is to provide motorcycle taxi service.  He works everyday from seven in the morning until nine at night.  Over time he has been able to increase his hours each day.  For the future, he dreams of having another motorcycle taxi in order to generate more income for his family.  The motive for the loan is to purchase tires, gas, and to make some improvements to his motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to purchase tires, gas, and to make some improvements to his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jewellery, perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy 8 suits for her band's shows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, cosmetics, sheets and underwear.

loans.name: Vilma De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Vilma De Jesús ella tiene 43 años. Su actividad es la venta de granos básicos, desde hace mas de 10 años que tiene este negocio, ella es una mujer que siempre está buscando la forma de evolucionar con su negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan porque los precios de sus productos los ofrece de manera accesible. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de arroz, maíz, concentrado entre otros. Ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Vilma De Jesús is 43 years old. She sells basic grains and has been in this business for more than 10 years. Vilma is a woman who is always looking for ways to transform her business. Most of her customers do business with her because the prices of the products she offers are affordable.

The reason for this loan is so that she can buy rice, corn, concentrated feed, and other products. She is happy with this loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, concentrated feed, and other products.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
Darío es un padre ejemplar, a sus 61 años tiene 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 13 años. Hace 2 años que Vacelisa, su esposa falleció, desde entonces trabaja arduamente para evitar que a sus hijos les falte algo. Darío vive con sus hijos en una casita rústica pero propia en el anexo de Pumpuriani. Siempre se ha dedicado a las labores del campo, en sus 5 hectáreas de terrenos siembra café, plátanos, yuca y pituca. Además tiene otras 2 hectáreas que están sin producir.  En su ardua labor, sus 3 hijos lo ayudan, en la siembra, el cultivo, los riegos, y las cosechas.  “Sembrar café siempre me ha dado buen dinero, a pesar de que se cosechen cada 2 veces al año, pero vale la pena”, menciona Darío sobre la rentabilidad de su negocio. Señala, además que los problemas económicos han sido los obstáculos más difíciles que ha tenido que pasar, ya que muchas veces no le alcanzaba el dinero para comprar semillas de café y abonos. Aparte de la agricultura, Darío cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su hogar, ahí expende productos varios, pero que urge implementar y surtir.
Con los ingresos que obtenga de las cosechas, éste padre luchador podrá comprar muebles para la tienda y más productos para su venta, así se asegurará más clientela.  Con éste serían 6 los préstamos que Darío obtiene de MFP, y para que él pueda sobresalir junto a su familia, le es urgente su ayuda. Por otro lado se siente a gusto trabajando con “Las Abejitas de Pumpuriani”, nombre de su banco comunal, que hace referencia a su inagotable labor como grupo. Con el dinero del crédito, Darío comprará semillas de café para preparar los viveros para ello deberá enriquecer la tierra con abonos orgánicos, así avizora la cosecha para abril y mayo. Aproximadamente gastará solo en abonos 800 soles.
texts.en:
61-year old Darío is a wonderful father to his three children aged 17, 15, and 13. His wife Vacelisa died two years ago, and since then he has worked hard to ensure that his children lack for nothing. He lives with his children in a simple house that belongs to him in an area adjacent to Pumpuriani. 

Darío has always worked in agriculture. On his five hectares of land he grows coffee, bananas, yucca, and pituca. He also has another two hectares which are lying fallow. His three children help him with the work: planting, tending, watering, and harvesting the crops. “Growing coffee has always provided me with a good income despite having to harvest twice a year,” says Darío when talking about the profitability of his work, “but it’s worth the trouble.” He says overcoming financial issues has been his biggest problem as on occasion he hasn’t been able to afford to buy coffee plants and fertilizer. 

 As well as his fields, Darío has a small store in his home where he sells various products. It urgently needs more stock. 

With the income from his harvests, this hardworking father will be able to buy furnishings for his store and more items to sell which, in turn, will bring in more customers. As well, he will have his sixth loan from MFP with which he and his family will be able to get ahead. He enjoys working with Las Abejitas de Pumpurani (the name of his community bank), and the tireless work the group has done. 

He plans to buy coffee seedlings and manure to enrich the soil with the loan money so he can look forward to a good harvest in April and May. The manure alone will cost about 800 soles.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings and bags of manure

loans.name: Los Nuevos Amigos (Calceta) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Nuevos Amigos se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”, por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace cuatro meses atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho para mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar vive la señora Miriam, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11,  10 y de 1 año de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. El marido es guardia de seguridad.

Ella se dedica a la venta de  sabanas, sobrecamas y ropa por catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella trabaja más a base de  pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 11h30 ya que a esa hora tiene que preparar el almuerzo para cuando lleguen sus hijos de la escuela y en la tarde no sale porque tiene que ayudar a sus hijos, pero si atiende a los clientes que llegan hasta su casa, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Lleva 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más sabanas, sobrecamas y ropa por catalogo. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Los Nuevos Amigos" (New Friends) meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta, a city described as incomparable due to the beauty of its women and because the locals consider it the most beautiful city in the world.

This group of people decided to get together four months ago and form this Communal Bank, which has been a great help to them in improving their small businesses. They are engaged in various activities such as trading, providing services, selling meals and so on.

Señora Miriam is a local. She is 29 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has three children aged 11, 10 and one. The eldest two are studying in school. Her husband is a security guard.

She works at selling sheets, bedspreads and clothing through a catalog. She sells door-to-door and also from home in the case of her best-known customers. She works mostly from customer orders received. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 11.30 a.m. Then she prepares lunch for when her children come in from school. She does not go out in the afternoon as she has to help her children, but she does attend to customers who come to the house. She gives her customers credit and then collects payment on the weekends. She has dedicated the last four years to this business and it is going well.

She will use this loan to buy more sheets, bedspreads and clothing by catalog. This is her first loan cycle in the Communal Bank and she likes the speed with which the loans are issued.

Her dream is that her children should want for nothing.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads and clothing.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efrain tiene 28 años de edad, convive hace 10 años con Nerida. Ambos vieron nacer 3 hijos de 11, 8 y 2 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad de Pumpuriani. Efrain y su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, con la siembra de piñas y café, cuyos frutos se cosechan una vez al año.  El café es uno de los productos que más demanda tiene en la zona, aún así Efrain se arriesga en la siembra de piñas, situación que ha sabido controlar abonando sus tierras 3 veces al año, en ese proceso gasta 1200 soles por parcela o cuadra. Efrain cuenta que cada una de sus cuadras de terrenos produce 8 camionadas de piñas de 10 toneladas, vendiendo cada una de ellas a 3000 soles. Teniendo en cuenta que tiene 5 cuadras de terrenos, Efrain obtiene una buena rentabilidad en sus productos, “la ventaja es que yo vendo mis piñas por camión y ya me evito el problema de que se malogren o pudran”, explica. Con el pasar del tiempo, a Efrain le gustaría tener una casa más bonita, cambiar el techo de palos por uno de madera, eso gracias a sus ahorros y al trabajo con su comunidad. Con fe, Efrain podrá obtener su préstamo número 6 de MFP, para ello necesita de la solidaridad de todos para continuar su camino hacia el progreso. “Estoy conforme con este apoyo que me brindan tanto la MFP y mi banco comunal por que cuando necesito algo puedo contar con ellos”, concluye. Con el dinero él invertirá en la compra de abonos para sus parcelas de piña, lo cual estima costará alrededor de 1500 soles lo que completará con el dinero de su última cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Efraín, 28, has lived with Nérida for 10 years; they have three children who are 11, 8 and 2 years old.  They all live together in their own house located in the community of Pumpuriani.  Efraín and his wife are farmers; they grow pineapples and coffee which is harvested once a year.  Coffee is one of the area’s products that has the highest demand but even so Efraín dares to plant pineapples, a situation he is able to manage by fertilizing his land three times a year.  

He spends 1200 soles per parcel or cuadra [Central American land measure] doing this.  Efraín relates that each of his cuadras of land produces eight 10-ton truckloads which are sold for 3000 soles each.  Keeping in mind that Efraín has 5 cuadras of land, he obtains good profits for his products.  “The advantage is that I sell my pineapples by the truckload myself and avoid their rotting or becoming damaged that way,” he explains.  In time, Efraín would like to have a prettier house, to replace the roof of reeds with a wooden one.  This will be thanks to his savings and community work.  

Efraín has hope of obtaining his MFP loan #6 but needs the support of all of you to do so and to continue on his road toward success.  “I agree with this support I’m getting from MFP and from my communal bank because when I need something I can count on them,” he concludes.  He will use the money to buy sacks of manure for his pineapple crops which he estimates will cost about 1500 soles; he will make up the difference with money he got from his previous coffee harvest.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Mariela Del Socorro

texts.es: Mariela Del Socorro tiene 36 años, es madre de 2 hijos.  Ella, es el sostén de su familia, desde Hace 5 año que se dedica al negocio de brindar el servicio de costura sus vecino ya conocen el trabajo de Mariela y la buscan para que pueda confeccionar sus prendas de vestir. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que ella es su propia jefa de su negocio. Con el crédito desea comprar productos como hilos, tijeras, telas, bordados, cintas entre otros. Sueña con algún día poder realizarle modificaciones a su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Mariela Del Socorro is 36 years old and the mother of two children. She is the breadwinner of her family. For the past five years, Mariela has managed a business in which she provides sewing services to her neighbors who are familiar with her work and are looking to buy handmade clothing. What she likes most about her work is that she gets to be her own boss.

With this loan, Mariela will buy products such as thread, scissors, fabrics, embroideries, ribbons, and other supplies. She dreams of someday making renovations to her modest home.

loans.use: to buy thread, scissors, fabrics, embroideries, ribbons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Bernicia

texts.es: Bernicia de 24 años de edad convive con su esposo hace 7 años, ambos vieron nacer 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años. Todos ellos habitan un hogar propio y humilde en la comunidad de Pumpuriani. Berni, como la llaman de cariño, se dedica a la agricultura. Su esposo es el que comanda la producción de sus sembríos que abarcan plátanos, café, cítricos y paltas. Berni por su parte, dirige las labores de su casa y su pequeña tienda de golosinas y gaseosas; de vez en cuando apoya en el campo. Los frutos de los plátanos son cosechados cada quince días, por esa razón no falta ingresos cada dos veces al mes para los bolsillos de ésta joven familia. “En una ocasión perdí 3000 soles por culpa de los gusanos, mis plantas de plátanos crecieron, se volvieron amarillas y ya no dieron frutos”, señala. Ésta mujer emprendedora, más adelante quisiera ampliar su negocio de golosinas y convertirla en una bodega surtida, por que sabe que es muy rentable, así se dedicaría más a sus hijos y hogar. Con mucha ayuda, ésta familia podrá acceder a su crédito número 6 de MFP, capital que están dispuestos a pagar puntualmente. “La ayuda que MFP y mi banco comunal nos brindan significa para nosotros un gran apoyo”, menciona Berni. Con el dinero del préstamo, Berni y su familia podrán limpiar sus terrenos de la “mala hierba” y quitar los arbustos innecesarios, para ello comprarán machetes y pagarán al personal que lo realizará, cuyo pago es de 30 soles diarios por operario. Así también invertirán en semillas de café.
texts.en:
Bernicia, 24, has lived with her husband for seven years; they have two children who are 7 and 3 years old. They all live together in their own, humble home in the community of Pumpuriani.  Berni, as she’s affectionately called, is a farmer.  Her husband is the main force behind the farming which includes bananas, coffee, citrus fruit and avocado.  Berni, on her part, does the household chores and runs a small snack and soft-drinks shop; once in a while she also helps in the fields. 

Bananas are harvested every two weeks so this young family can count on having cash in their pockets at least twice a month.  “On one occasion, I lost 3000 soles because of the worms; my banana plants grew, turned yellow and did not bear fruit,” she indicates.  This enterprising woman would like to expand her snack selling into a full-fledged, well-stocked grocery store because she knows it is very profitable and that way she could dedicate more time to her home and children.  

With much help, this family will be able to access their MFP loan #6, capital that they are determined to repay punctually.  “The support that MFP and my communal bank give me means a great help to us,” Berni mentions.

With the loan money, Berni and her family will be able to clear the “bad weeds” from their fields and remove the unnecessary bushes.  To do so, they will buy machetes and pay labor costs for the personnel that will do the job who are paid 30 soles per day per worker.  They will also buy coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy machetes and hire day laborers and also to buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es: Sara Maria se dedica a ofrecer los servicios notariales. Desde hace dos meses ella quería realizarle estas mejoras a su vivienda pero no había podido porque no tenía el dinero suficiente. Solicita el Crédito para comprar madera, zinc, piedrín, arena y cemento.  Ella sueña con lograr construir su casa muy bonita, para poder disfrutarla con su familia. El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia gracias al crédito.
texts.en:
Sara Maria provides notary services. For the past two months, she has wanted to make improvements to her home but she has not been able due to a lack of sufficient funds. She is requesting a loan to buy wood, zinc, gravel, sand, and cement. Sara dreams of building a very nice house so that she can enjoy it with her family.

Thanks to the help of this loan, the quality of life for her family will improve.

loans.use: to buy materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es: Jose Adrian tiene 46 años, es un hombre trabajador, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos, por lo que sabe las experiencias que ha atravesado. Lleva 18 años con su actividad que es una pulpería y venta de pescado, sabe que tiene que esforzarse y dedicarle tiempo a su negocio, no hay nada difícil, su único  fin es solventar los gastos económicos de su hogar. Con el tiempo desea mejorar. Este será su crédito número 3 con el que comprara granos básicos, jugos, sopas, enlatados, cigarrillos, fósforos y papel higiénico. Con el crédito solicitado, podrá comprar lo necesario para su actividad.
texts.en:
Jose Adrian is 46 years old and a hardworking gentleman.  This is not the first time he has requested loans, so he is familiar with the process.  He has been in business for 18 years, both managing a store and selling fish.  Adrian knows that he must strive and devote time to his business, so he has not had any difficulties.  His only wish is to cover his household expenses.  He wants to improve over time.

This will be his third loan and he will use the money to buy basic grains, juices, soups, canned goods, cigarettes, matches, and toilet paper.  The loan he requested will enable him to buy whatever he needs for his business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, juices, soups, canned goods, cigarettes, matches, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Racar Bajo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Racar Bajo está formado por 5 socias y 3 socios quienes se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos y tejas, este trabajo artesanal lo han aprendido de sus padres y ahora ellos continúan con esta actividad para no dejar este trabajo tradicional. Viven en  la comunidad de Racar en Cuenca, este lugar  se caracteriza por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente  es muy cálida y amable, se dedican a la artesanía que es la elaboración de ladrillos y tejas, muchos tambien laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Aída, tiene 46 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 28, 23, 20, 17, 14 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, su segundo hijo estudia en la universidad, su tercera hija  estudia en una academia de belleza, su cuarto hijo trabaja y estudia en un colegio a distancia y su ultima hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo no se encuentra en el país ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo  para poder sacar adelante a su familia. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña Aída se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos y tejas, esta actividad  la realiza hace 30 años, aprendiendo esta actividad de sus padres. En su casa se dedican a la cría de pollos, cuyes y cerdos y también se dedica a la agricultura, lo que siembra es sola para su consumo.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de arcilla para continuar con su fábrica de ladrillos y tejas. 

Su meta es crecer en su fábrica de ladrillos.
texts.en:
The Racar Bajo communal bank has five female and three male members who work making bricks and tiles.  They have learned this artisanal job from their parents and now they continue with this work so as not to abandon this traditional job.  They live in the community of Racar in Cuenca.  This place is known for the beauty of its landscapes and its warm and friendly people who work in the art of making bricks and tiles.  Many also work in the city in various activities.

One of the members of this group is Aída.  She is 46 years old and in her marriage she has had five children, ages, 28, 23, 20, 17, and 14.  Her oldest child is married and independent.  Her second child studies in the university.  Her third child studies in a beauty academy.  Her four child works and studies in a distance high school.  And her youngest child studies in a school in the city.  Her husband is not in the country; he has migrated in search of a better job to be able to get his family ahead.  The house in which she lives is her own property.

Aída works making bricks and tiles.  She has been doing this work for 30 years, having learned it from her parents.  In her home they work raising chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.  She also works in agriculture; what she grows is only for her consumption.

She's going to use the money from her loan to buy clay to continue with her brick and tile factory.

Her objective is to grow in her brick factory.

loans.use: to buy clay.

loans.name: Isidro De La Cruz

texts.es: Isidro De La Cruz tiene 48 años. El se dedica a la venta de refrescos de chicha y pan con mantequilla. Empieza su labor desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, el tiene recurre a un lugar que es transitado por varios clientes.  Solicita el Crédito para comprar bolsas, pajillas, azúcar, maíz, pan, mantequilla entre otros productos. El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y la de su negocio. Los desafíos que se le presenta muy frecuentes son: la competencia y precio de los productos.
texts.en:
Isidro De La Cruz is 48 years old. He sells “chicha” (a beverage made from corn) and bread with butter. He begins his work at 8am and continues until 6pm. Isidro returns to a busy place where he can find many customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy bags, straws, sugar, corn, bread, butter, and other products. This loan will be a great help because it will help him to improve his quality of life and his business. He frequently deals with challenges such as the competition and the price of his products.

loans.use: to buy bags, straws, sugar, corn, bread, butter, and other products.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Maria Mercedes se dedica a la venta de productos plásticos hace 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ya tiene clientela y muchos clientes ya realizan sus pedidos, a ciertos clientes les deja sus productos al contado como también a crédito, es muy buena cliente, trabajadora y muy responsable. Con el dinero del crédito comprara platos, vasos, baldes, cubiertos desechables y bolsas de todos los tamaños.  La señora se encuentra agradecida por la confianza y el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Maria Mercedes has sold plastic items for 14 years. She has a customer base and many customers make orders. She sells to some customers on credit, but others pay in cash. Maria is a very good client; she is very hard-working and responsible. With the money from this loan, she will buy plates, glasses, buckets, disposable cutlery, and bags of all sizes. She is very grateful for your support and confidence in her.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, buckets, disposable cutlery and bags of all sizes.

loans.name: Keyla Vanessa

texts.es:
La  joven Keyla  Vanessa,  tiene 21 años de edad, vive con sus padres en la comunidad rural de Sabanetas, municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Barbara.
Ella inicio su negocio de venta de ropa, con el objetivo de obtener ingresos para apoyar económicamente a su familia ya que no disponía de un empleo.
En la actualidad ha solicitado un préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa como ser: camisas, blusas, pantalones y otras prendas de mayor demanda.
Considera que hasta el momento ha tenido ingresos que le permiten hacerse cargo de los gastos de su familia y eso le da la motivación para seguir adelante con su negocio.
Ella espera seguir invirtiendo sus ganancias en ampliar su inventario y ofrecer variedad y calidad de mercadería a sus clientes para lograr un negocio rentable y duradero.
texts.en:
Kayla Vanessa is a 21 year old young woman.  She lives with her parents in the rural community of Sabanets in the Macuelizo municipality, Santa Barbara.

She started her business of selling clothes in order to get income to financially support her faminy because she did not have a job.

She has currently requested a loan to buy clothes like shirts, blouses, pants, and other garments that are in great demand.  She believes that so far she has gotten income that allows her to take charge of the family expenses.  This gives her the motivation to get ahead with her business.

She hopes that by using her income to increase her inventory and offer her customers variety and quality merchandise she will procure a profitable and sustainable business.

loans.use: to buy clothes (shirts, blouses, and pants, etc.).

loans.name: G.s. Unidas En Cristo Group

texts.es: Santos Juana y Maria Auxiliadora conforman el grupo Unidas en Cristo. Santos Juana tiene 5 años en el negocio de la venta de ropa usada. Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes que siempre le solicitan tallas extras grandes, siempre está brindando el mejor esfuerzo para mejorar su negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos, entre otros. Sueña con agrandar su inventario cada día más.
texts.en: Santos Juan and Maria Auxiliadora are members of the Unidos en Cristo ["United in Christ"] group. Santos Juan has had a used clothing buisness for five years. She has a large variety of customers who are always asking for extra-large sizes. She always does her very best to improve her business. This loan is for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits, among other items. Santos Juana dreams of expanding her inventory more every day.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits, among other items.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika es una mujer sencilla. Se dedica a una pulpería desde hace 7 años. Empieza su negocio desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche que llegan sus clientes a comprar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergente, papel higiénico y sopas. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Erika se encuentra feliz por esta oportunidad.
texts.en: Erika is an uncomplicated woman. She has had a grocery store for seven years. She opens her business at 7 in the morning and works until 9 at night, since this is when her customers come to shop. The reason for the loan is to buy staple foods, candies, soft drinks, bread, detergent, toilet paper, and soups. Furthermore, she promises to be punctual in her loan payments. Erika is happy to have this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy basic foods, candies, soft drinks, bread, detergent, toilet paper, and soups for her store

loans.name: Shinenemehbayar

texts.en: Shinenemehbayar is 22 years old and lives with his disabled mother and brother in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul Province, Mongolia. His brother helps with his business. He started his firewood retailing business in 2008 since he had no money to put himself through college. He goes through a forest and collects dead trees to resell. He needs a motorcycle to transport the firewood. He is a sharp and diligent man who says,"It is hard and slow to collect wood by walking. If I collect it by vehicle, it would be fast and profitable and then I can put my younger brother into a college." He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport the firewood

loans.name: Chiev

texts.en:
Chiev is 26 year-old and a mother of three children, living in the province of Siem Reap in Cambodia. She is a farmer, growing rice and vegetables. Most of her income is from selling vegetables. She is able to earn approximately $1.50 per day to meet her financial needs and to support her children's education.

Since her house is too small and old, Chiev has tried hard to save money to expand and fix it partially. However, her capital is inadequate. Now she is looking for a loan from HKL and Kiva’s funders to supplement to her existing savings to fix her house. She hopes this fund will provide her family a suitable shelter for living.

loans.use: to fix her house

loans.name: Baterdene

texts.en:
Baterdene is 47 years old and lives with his two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His wife sews traditional clothes at home and their two kids are school students. 

He started his wooden craft making business in 1981. He has all the required tools to make wooden crafts such as traditional furniture and home-wares. Now that number of tourists are increasing, his product demand is increasing as well. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "I have mission to get my kids educated". He is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy more wood.

loans.use: To buy more wood to craft traditional furniture and home-wares

loans.name: Nhip

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhip,31, has been in the business of cultivating rice and vegetables in the Siem Reap province. She has grown different kinds of vegetables through the years; it depends on the market and the demand of the customers. She certainly enjoys doing her business because she is skillful and has learned a lot from her previous experiences. 

Typically, she gets a profit of $2.00 per day to support her family, especially her two school-aged children. Although, the main source of income comes from her husband who provides a Tuk Tuk taxi-service around the province. Presently, the motorcycle and trailer need repair, so Mrs. Nhip would like to ask for a loan from Kiva to pay to fix her husband's taxi and to support her husband’s business. This is her second loan with Kiva. She has never made a late payment on her previous loan.

loans.use: to fix her husband's taxi

loans.name: Baasanhuu

texts.en:
Baasanhuu is 37 years old, and lives with his wife and two kids in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. His two kids are college students. 

He started his grocery retail business in 2007 by renting a shop. Now that the Mongolian economy is booming, he needs to renew his products and repair his shop in order to keep up with the growth. He is a sharp and diligent man who says "People are demanding more healthy and expensive products, therefore I need to renew my range of products completely". He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more grocery products.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to sel

loans.name: Bunna

texts.en:
Bunna is a mason, while his wife, Savang (pictured together) stays at home and does housework. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have five children- four sons and one daughter. Two are traditional musicians and other two are still young.  

Bunna is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Bunthan

texts.en:
Bunthan (in the photo) and her husband, Vin, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1992 and have three children- one son and two daughters. Two are garment workers and the other one is in school. 

Bunthan is hired by her villagers to farm. She gets paid with fees. Her husband is a fisherman and does construction work. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to repair the house where she lives because the house is old and breaks in some part. She will also use a part of the loan to assist in her husband’s fishing business by buying a boat and fishing nets.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives and assist in her husband’s fishing business by buying a boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Chandalis

texts.en:
Chandalis (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Longvanna, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2008 and have two young children. 

Chandalis is a weaver. Her husband sells bread. He buys bread from the market and transports it by bicycle to sell in his village and the nearby villages. He used to be a security guard. He wants a motorbike which would be easier for him to carry bread to sell than his bicycle. 

Hence, Chandalis is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to carry bread to sell. She will also use a part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to carry bread to sell and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap (pictured above) and her husband, Sophal, have been married since 2006 and have one son who is in grade eight. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River, approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sopheap is a weaver, while her husband now raises cows at home. Sopheap wants to supplement her work with a new business and invest with her neighbor to grow rice, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000.The money will go towards buying seed fertilizer and pesticides to maintain the rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed fertilizer and pesticides to maintain the rice farm.

loans.name: Sinoeun

texts.en:
Sinoeun (in the photo) is 45 years old and his wife, Bunvon is 37 years old. They have been married since 1999 and have two children- one son and one daughter. They are living on an island in the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sinoeun is a house constructor, while his wife is a weaver. Sinoeun is operating his business by investing with his brother, but he now wants to run the business independently. Hence, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy construction crane materials.

loans.use: To buy construction crane materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy basic ingredients to prepare bread. Other group members will buy sandals and household and sewing items.

loans.name: Bunthan

texts.en:
Bunthan (in the photo) and his wife, Chantrea, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have two young children- one son and one daughter.

Bunthan is a blacksmith. His wife is now a weaver. Bunthan wants to supplement his business with a new business and invest with his neighbor to grow rice, so he is asking for a loan of $500. The money will go towards buying seed fertilizer and pesticides to maintain the rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed fertilizer and pesticides to maintain the rice farm.

loans.name: Sa Em

texts.en:
Sa Em (pictured above) and her husband, Koem Cheth, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two children: one son and one daughter.

Sa Em is a weaver. Additionally, she buys additional silk fabric from her fellow villagers and transports it to sell in other provinces. She hopes to expand her business by purchasing more finished silk fabrics for resale. That’s why she is applying for another loan in the amount of $1,000.

loans.use: To buy additional finished silk fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Mrs. Say is the resident of Prey Chhor district, Kompong Cham province. She lives in a common law relationship with her husband and has given birth to 3 children, all of whom are young, and not enrolled in school yet. Say has been cultivating rice crops for her livelihood for ages. This business earns her around $2.00 each day but it seems barely enough to cover her daily expenses. Say’s husband usually helps her to grow rice during the rainy season and also takes some time to operate his own business as well. He has a skill of making a type of ice creams, so every day he rides his bike to sell his products only to the people in the local community. Say wants her husband to deliver his products to the people in other areas, so as to have a good chance to create more profit. Anyway, using a bicycle is not a good transportation method to reach this goal. Therefore, Say is taking out a loan form Kiva through HKL to support her husband’s business. This loan will be used to purchase a second-hand motorcycle. In the future, she hopes to expand the business of her husband and support all her children to enroll in the local school.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Kemheang

texts.en:
Kemheang is 38 years old and his wife, Sreyvon is 29 years old (pictured together). They live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have two children, one attends school and  the other one is still young.  

Kemheang is a farmer and drives a motor taxi when he is not at the farm. His wife is a garment worker. He is asking for a loan of $500 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Sochea (pictured here) and her husband, Roeung, live in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers from the city. They have six children: two sons and four daughters. Three are married and live in separate homes, one is a teacher and another one is in university. 

Sochea and her husband are rice farmers. Roeung is also a retired teacher. Sochea is asking for her first loan in the amount of $200 to pay school fees for her daughter who is in university.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughter who is in university.

loans.name: Sphy

texts.en:
Sphy (shown in the photo) is 30 years old. Her husband, Mr. Phally Ny, is 22. They have been married since 2008 and have a 1-year-old son. The family lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sphy has been a tailor since 2007. She operates the business at home. Her husband is a lathe operator. She is requesting her first loan of $1,100 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy additional fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun is 40 years old. His wife, Ngon, is 41 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them are in school. The family is living along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saroeun and his wife are farmers. They grow rice and lotus on their farmland in the village where they live. Saroeun is requesting a loan of $600 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.   

In the photo, Saroeun is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna, 24, is a silk weaver. Her husband, Poeurn, 37, is a soldier. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2007 and have one young son. 
  
Vanna is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.    

Photo: Vanna is not pictured with her loom because the house where she lives is flooded, so she needs to move her looms to the place that is not affected by flooding.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different variety to sell to her customers at a profit.
 
She also does decorative embroidery works. She started these businesses six years ago to financially assist her family. Now she is well established in her businesses and earns a reasonable income every month. 

She is married and her husband has a furniture making business. He is very much expert in his business and sells his furniture to different furniture selling shops in the market and also supplies to other cities on order. 

Najma is the mother of three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver, the second one is an auto vehicle mechanic, and her two daughters do decorative embroidery and help her in managing her business. Her youngest son is studying in class 9th. 

Najma is very confident that an investment will help her improve her clothes selling business and that she will be able to buy some dowry from her extra income to see that her elder daughter soon marries. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Najma.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Tat

texts.en: Tat is 28 years old. She lives in Phu Man village. She is married and has three children who are going to school. She not only grows rice but she sells packaging as well. She has had this job for five years. She has a monthly income of about 10,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to expand her business (by buying more packaging to resell).

loans.use: to buy more packaging to resell.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen was born in 1979. She lives in Phu Man village with her husband and two children. She grows rice and she buys and sells packaging. She has a monthly income of about 9,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to expand her business by buying more packaging.

loans.use: to buy more packaging to sell

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng is 39 years old, and married with 3 children. For the last 20 years, she has been earning her living as a farmer. She also plants cassava for additional income. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan to cultivate her rice paddy and plant cassava. With this loan she hopes to increase her crop yield which enables her to earn more income to feed her family, and have some savings for the future.

loans.use: to cultivate her rice paddy and plant cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Pheap is 24 years old, married, with no children. She is a farmer and she also plants cassava for an additional income. She has been farming on her farmland for two years to make a living. She is requesting her first loan with VisionFund to cultivate a rice paddy and also plant cassava. With this loan, she hopes to increase crop yield and earn more income, which will enable her to set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: to cultivate a rice paddy and plant cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
Mok is a 37-year-old married woman, who lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has a life partner in her husband with three single children. 
All of her children are attending a public school in the province. Mok earns a living by growing rice and vegetable crops on her own farmland, making a profit of $1.5 per day. 
Mok’s husband has just registered to work as a security guard. To start this work, the security company requires all new staff to pay in advance for membership, training, clothes and food, but Mok doesn’t have enough money to pay for that. So now she would like to ask for $200USD from HKL and Kiva, to spend mainly on fixing her present house. In addition, the rest of this fund will be used to pay for her husband’s new work. In the future, she plans to continue supporting her children until they finish high school.

loans.use: to mainly fix her present house and to pay in advance for her husband’s new work.

loans.name: Shahar

texts.ru: Шахар жительница района Шахритус. Она замужем. Ей 50 лет. У нее пятеро детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и сеет пшеницу для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян пшеницы и минеральных удобрений. В дальнейшем она хочет за счет полученной прибыли отремонтировать свой дом. Шахор надеется, что кредиторы Кива помогут ей в продвижении ее деятельности и улучшению уровня жизни.
texts.en: Shahar is a resident of the Shahrituz region. She is married. She is 50 year old and has five children. She has secondary education. Shahar rents out a parcel of land where she grows vegetables and sows wheat for resale. She has been in this business for twelve years. She is taking out the loan to buy wheat seeds and mineral fertilizer. In the future she wants to use the profit to repair her house. Shahar hopes that Kiva lenders will help her in growth of her business and improvement of quality of live.

loans.use: to buy seeds of wheat and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for the expansion of her grocery store business, which she started a year ago. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk. This will allow her to fulfill the demands of her clients and increase her profits. 
Her husband works in a government organization for a low income. Mussarat has two sons and both of them are getting their education by attending a local school. She is also a very good mother and housewife. She tries her best to give comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 
She is very confident that an investment will help her expand her business and increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж вместе с сыном находится на заработках в России. Сама Саломат занимается торговлей овощей на рынке. Она в этой области пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки болгарского перца, чаки, томата, салатов, помидоров и зелени.
texts.en: Salomat lives in the J.Rumy district.  She is 32 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband and son are both working in Russia.  Salomat is involved in selling vegetables at the market and has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of Bulgarian peppers, chaka, salads, tomatoes and greens.

loans.use: to purchase Bulgarian peppers, chaka, salads, tomatoes and greens

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is married and blessed with one child who is in school. For the last two years, he has been running a cafeteria to make a living. He also does farming to increase his income. Stephen has employed one person to help him to manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as wheat flour and cooking fat. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married and blessed with seven children. For the last twelve years, she has been running a grocery business to support her family. The major challenge she faces is competition, but she is able to retain some of her customers because of her good customer care. She has employed one person to help her to manage the business. 

She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business into wholesale.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. For the last two years, she has been running a grocery business to make a living. She also does dairy farming to increase her income. Esther has been able to retain her good reputation with her customers. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. Esther has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy potatoes, carrots and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, carrots and vegetables.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 31 years old, married, and supports her family by weaving carpets. She takes orders from her customers and fulfills them to earn profits. Her husband works in a vegetable market and sells vegetables.
 
She knows the importance of education and has enrolled all of her children into school. She is a great wife and a very caring mother who is raising her children very well and also does her household responsibilities in an efficient manner.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her carpet weaving business. With the loan, she will purchase raw materials and also some tools for the further expansion of her business. She has 15 years of working experience in her business and is confident that an investment will be a very profitable one for her. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia”.

loans.use: To buy raw materials & weaving tools for her carpet weaving business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man, age 30, and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. He has been operating a salon to earn a living. He has been in the business for the last two years. He also runs a barber shop for more income.
