He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a blow dryer machine and hair chemicals. In the next 5 years, he plans to manage a wholesale business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is married and blessed with six children. She has been farming for the last twenty years to make a living. She also runs a retail shop to increase her income. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizer and seeds. In the next 5 years, she wants to become the major fruit distributor in her region. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock of wire mesh.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a hardworking business man, aged 29. He is married and blessed with two children who are in school. He does photography to earn a living. His potential customers are residents of his locality. James has employed one person to help him to run the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business and employ more people. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a camera.

loans.use: To buy a camera.

loans.name: Ameena's Group

texts.en:
Ameena is 39 years old, married, and has a son and a daughter.
  
In order to afford the living expenses of her family, she runs a grocery store at home. She sells different grocery items such as cooking oils, spices, sugar, etc. She is very fair in her rates and earns good profits every month. 

Her son also works with her in her grocery store. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her grocery store business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk that will allow her to fulfill her clients’ orders and make more profit. 

She has had this business for the past two years and is confident that an investment will help her make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for weighing machines.

loans.name: Maryani

texts.en:
Maryani is 49 years old and married with three children. The youngest one, who is eight years old, is still in school and attending the third grade. Her husband works as a driver. She has a shop in front of her house selling daily needs such as eggs, sugar, snacks, gas,and many more. She has been doing this since her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. This is now her fifth loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She will use this loan to buy poster paper, electrical appliances and cardboard and sell them in her shop. 

Her business is going well and growing because she has loyal customers who continuously buy her products.  She hopes someday she can expand the store.  Her hopes for her family are that her children can all finish school and the family continues to stay healthy.

loans.use: to buy poster paper, electrical appliances and cardboard.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, 27, is a hardworking business woman. She is married and blessed with three children, two of whom are in school. 

Martha has been running a retail shop for the last five years to make a living. She also sells cereals to increase her income. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy beans and peas for resale. 

In the next five years, Martha wants to expand her business so she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans and peas.

loans.name: Saybi

texts.ru: Сайби проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Возраст, 58 лет. Вдова. У нее двое детей. Уже шесть лет как она занимается торговлей на рынке. Сайби занимается торговлей тканей. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Saybi lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube.  She is 58 years, a widow and has two children.  Saybi has been involved in retail sales at the market for six years and sells fabrics.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 57 years old, married, and has three children.  He has been operating a hardware business for the past eleven years.  He was previously employed before he went into business. His desire is to open other outlets of his business in five years.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused on his business and hopes to expand and improve his standard of living.

John has requested a loan of 55,000 Kenya shillings to buy paints and nails.

loans.use: to buy paint and nails.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 37 years old, married, and has two children, aged 2 and 5.  He has been running a grocery to earn a living. Besides, he sells cereals to earn extra income.  He has been in this business for four years.  He was previously employed before he went into business.

He needs 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals. Harrison hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Sadia's Group

texts.en:
Sadia is the mother of a daughter who is studying in local school. She is also a very good housewife and performs her routine duties very well. 

Her husband is a clerk. His income is not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family, and so Sadia started her sewing business. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and fulfills them on time to earn profits. 

Sadia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy another sewing machine and will hire a worker. That will allow her to complete her orders on time and even getting more orders and earn more profits.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and father of three children.

Halim has been an owner of a mobile shop since 2008, selling mobiles and accessories. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a loan of $3000 in order to make display cases, advertising board and build an outdoor ceiling. He is aiming to gain more profits to allow him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to make display cases, advertising board and to build an outdoor ceiling.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 46 years old married. She has four children, age 11 to 22. She has no additional dependents and lives in her own house in Hoima, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children.

She has a poultry business which she has been doing for two years. She started with 50 birds but now she has 250 birds, both layers and broilers. Her future dream is to grow her business to 500 birds.

Alice needs a loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Kephar

texts.en:
Kephar has benefited from his previous loan from Faulu Kenya because he increased his stock. He has also gained more knowledge on business management skills, and this has helped him to improve the business.  

He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy cereals such as maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and father of two children.

Karim has owned a shop since 2008, selling old and used electrical items, clothing and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2100 in order to build an outdoor ceiling, advertising board and to increase inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to allow him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to build an outdoor ceiling, advertising board and to increase inventory.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a focused businessman, age 39. He is married and blessed with two children who are in school. 

He has been doing vehicle repairs for the last 13 years to support his family. Simon has employed three people to assist him to run the business. In the next five years, he plans to open another outlet of his business. Simon dreams of improving his living standard. 

With the 50,000 KES loan, he is intending to buy a tester machine.

loans.use: To buy a tester machine.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 32 years old and married. He has one child and lives in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his dependents and child up to university.

He has a motorcycle business and he has been doing this for eight years. He bought his first motorcycle through a loan and worked hard to pay off the loan. He faces a challenge of bad roads, though he expects to own at least four motorcycles in the future.

Patrick wants a loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married and blessed with an 11-year-old child who goes to school. 

For the last six years, she has been running a boutique to make a living. She has employed two people to assist her in the the business. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has been able to improve her business and her living standards.

In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. 

Anna is requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to add stock of clothes.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Naghma's Group

texts.en:
Naghma is 49 years old and married. She is a housewife, very efficient in manners and performs her duties very well. She has given birth to eight children. One of them is studying while others do different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family. 

Her husband has a spare parts shop in the market.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s spare parts business. With the loan, he will purchase different brands of spare parts for his shop that will allow him to make more sales and increase his profits.
 
Naghma is very confident that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and increase his income, and her family will be able to enjoy a better life as a result.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a 38-year-old married man with four children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate all his children to higher institutions and expand his business.

He started with a drug shop and later diverted into produce buying, a business he has operated for the last ten years.

His challenge has been lack of capital to meet demand and his dream is a big food store. Emmy needs the loan to buy cereals for resale.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a cheerful lady who sells dried and smoked fish in an open-air market. Previously, she serviced a loan of 70,000 KES. She used the loan to add stock of dried and smoked fish and sacks for storage. With increased stock, she was able to make more sales and hence more income.

Eunice has requested another loan of 100,000 KES to add to her stock of dried fish.

loans.use: To add to her stock of dried fish.

loans.name: Daidora

texts.en:
Daidora is married and blessed with six children. Three of them are in school. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. 

He has been operating a motorbike transport business for three years to support his family. Previously, he was making doughnuts.  

In the next five years, he plans to buy a van for his transport business. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. Daidora has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy another motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Guddi's Group

texts.en:
Guddi is married and her husband is a scrap dealer. He sells scrap to different factories and to other dealers. His rates are very fair due to which he has a good number of clients which earns him good profits. 

Guddi is the mother of 6 children; one of them works with his father while the others stay at home. She herself is a very good mother and housewife, performing her daily tasks very well. She is also very supportive and helps her husband financially by doing embroidery work.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material in bulk quantity and earn more income by offering her clients more embroidery variety. 

She has been doing her business for the past 10 years and is very confident that an investment will help her improving her business better.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea is 41 years old, a widow who has been residing in Siem Reap province. She has only one child who is living together with her in a small home. She cultivates rice crops for her livelihood. She has been involved in agriculture for many years. Since she is alone with no one to help to raise her child, she has tried hard to work on her farmland and devote some time to earning more income by taking care of the animals for an animal market, located in the her commune. She typically earns around $4.00 from this business.

Because of the weather, Chea's house is broken and requires repair immediately. With her saved money and the loan of $300 she has requested from HKL, Chea will be able to fix some parts of her house, buy some materials for construction, and pay for labor. She would like to say thanks for the kindly help of Kiva’s funders.

loans.use: to fix some parts of her house, buy some materials for construction, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  maize, cassava and millet flour  to sell.

loans.name: Jus Makmur Group

texts.en:
Komariah is 47 years old and married with four children.  They are all of school age and are currently attending school.  She has been selling eggs, rice, flour, and sugar from a shop in front of her house since the year 2000.  Her husband is a driver.  She hopes that their combined income is enough to send all of her children to university in the future.

She enjoys her business because it is a daily stream of income and so far it has been going well.  However, there has been increased competition recently so she feels that by having this loan to increase her products she can grow her client base.

loans.use: to pay for more eggs, rice, flour, sugar to resell in her shop.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary, a 26-year old married father of three children, lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. His dream is to educate his children and have a source of income in addition to what he earns as a special-hire transport driver in order to support his family.

Hilary began in the produce business, where he was able to raise enough income to venture into the transport sector. His challenges include the traffic officers who demand bribes and mechanical breakdowns, but in spite of these obstacles he longs to buy a mini-bus. Hillary needs this loan to complete the payment for his motor vehicle.

loans.use: to complete payment of his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Ting Ting Nopar Group

texts.en:
Darisah is married and the mother of two children, Aziz and Relisa. In the picture she is standing in the middle, in front of her sewing machine. Her husband works as a laborer. Income from her husband is not enough to fulfill the family's basic needs. That's why, since 2007, she has been running a small sewing business in her house with only one sewing machine and one hemming machine. The business is going well but she can only receive a limited number of orders because she only has one machine. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia and she wants to use this money to buy zippers, needles, yarn and clips. 

In the future, she wants to have a sewing shop with multiple employees working for her. Because sewing is her hobby, she likes to run this business and she hopes she can receive more orders.

The other group members will use their loans for their businesses which include selling sandals, cosmetics, clothing on credit and selling coffee.

loans.use: to buy zippers, needles, yarn and clips.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 39 years old. She is married and has five children. To earn a living, she runs a grocery. She has been in this business for two years. She has employed two people to assist her in her tasks. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more focused in her business and she hopes to open other outlets of the business. Florence has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 54 years old. He is married to Veronica and together they have four children, ages 10, 14, 18 and 25. He operates a quarry and has been in this business for the past six years. He gets a monthly income of KES 8,100 from the business.

This is his third term loan. He paid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan amount to purchase mining tools for his business.

He will use the anticipated profit to purchase a piece of land. His dream is to become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase mining tools.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza needs another loan to pay for school fees for her children. The 53-year-old mother of five lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations and her dream is to become a commercial farmer.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is 46 years old, married and has three children.  To earn a living, he runs a greengrocery.  He has five years of experience in the business.  Besides, he is employed, hence he has employed one person to run his business in his absence.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has boosted his business with his previous loans and gained a lot of knowledge in business management skills.

His desire is to open another outlet of his business. He has requested for 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy tomatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Tath

texts.en:
Mrs. Tath, 61, is in the business of selling Khmer traditional cake in her province, Kompong Chhnang, and is a mother of four children. Some of her children are working and living separately because of their job or business. Her oldest daughter owns a store and sells mixed products, which can make a good profit, in a local market in Pursat province. And another one works as a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh city. They are cooperating well in earning income for the family. Though all of them are living far away from home, they always get in touch with their mother. 

Presently Tath’s daughter has run out of stock of her products for sale. Thus, Mrs. Tath is applying for a loan from Kiva to purchase merchandise for her daughter’s business. In the future, she hopes that her family can improve the businesses and earn a more comfortable income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her daughter’s business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fruit and to start selling chips.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 11 and 2.  Three of them go to school. 

Jane runs a fish store and has been in the business for five years. She has no employees. Jane heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more dried fish. Jane has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Jane would like to increase the size of her business.  

Her major challenges include high competition in the market, her low-income and her home expenses.   

Jane says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan for empowering women in terms of giving loans.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agro-chemicals for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a single man who is 26 years old. He has been running a grocery business for the last two years to make a living. Peter has been able to retain his business because of a good reputation with his customers. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Peter has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy carrots, onions and fruits for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy carrots, onions and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is a married man with three children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to expand his business and make a factory and also construct a permanent house. He has been in the arts and crafts business for the last ten years and has been challenged by lack of capital. He started as an employee and later saved money to start his own business. Ernest needs the loan to buy materials to use in his arts and crafts business.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in his arts and crafts business.

loans.name: Kenanga Cwg Group

texts.en:
Ida is 37 years old and married with one child. Her child is 10 years old and is currently attending elementary school. She has been selling mobile phone minutes to customers for the past year from her house.  The income enables her to supplement her husband's income as an employee at Dunkin' Donuts.  It is helpful because his income not only supports his family but also must be used to pay for his parents' living expenses.

Her business is growing because many people now know that they can buy mobile phone credits from her.  But now she needs a loan to buy more mobile phone credits to sell.  Her younger sibling is also getting married so she wants to help them. For her business, she eventually wants to have a store front to sell mobile phone minutes from.  For her family, she would like to have a house someday and have her child attend university.

Some of the other group members will use their loans for their businesses which include selling blocks of ice and washing clothing.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phone credits to sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 63-year-old married man with six children living with an extended family of twelve people in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children and build a strong self-reliant family. He has been farming for the last ten years and the challenge faced is seasonal changes. Christopher needs the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Antasia

texts.en:
Antasia is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 2.  Two of them go to school. 

Antasia has been running a food store business for two years. She has no employees. Antasia heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more food items like eggs, food spices, cabbages, and tomatoes. Antasia has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Antasia would like to hope for an increase in the size of her business and to have a good store.  

Her major challenges include having no one to help her in the market when she is sick, which leads to low income.  

Antasia says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan for helping women in terms of giving loans to people like her with low capital for business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like eggs, spices, cabbages, and tomatoes

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s cosmetics sales business. Her husband sells the cosmetics on his four-wheeled cart by visiting different areas.  He has been in this business for past six years. With the loan he will buy different brands of face creams, lotions, other cosmetics (mascara, eye-shadow, lipstick and nail polish) etc. in bulk that will allow him to attract more customers and make more sales.  

He will also use some of the loan money in repairing his cart.  

Nusrat is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and it will increase his sales and profits. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and repair a four-wheeled cart for cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Atulinda

texts.en:
Atulinda is 42 years old and father of eight children aged 10-19 living in Hioma, Uganda. He has other dependents and he lives in his own house with 11 family members. 

For seven years he has been farming and he started with a half an acre of land but now has ten acres. He faces a challenge of bad roads which makes transportation of his produce to the markets difficult and his vision is to start processing juice. Atulinda needs the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is married with three children aged 2-9 living in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. He has a produce business and he has been running it for 13 years. 

He faces a challenge of impassable roads and his dream is to have a stock of 7 million shillings and buy his own car for transporting his goods. Fred needs a loan to buy maize for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 33-year-old married woman with three children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is having her own house, expanding her business and educating her children.She has been selling clothes for the last three years and has earned profit. Her challenges have been seasonal customers and also defaulters. 

Judith needs the loan to buy bed covers, bedsheets, suitcases and women's outfits for resale as she targets the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy bed covers, bedsheets, suitcases and women's outfits for resale.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.en:
Paulino is a 36-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has five children between the ages of 15 and 4. Three of them go to school. 

Paulino runs a tailoring business. She has been in the business for eight years. She has no employees. Paulino heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loans officers. She is taking a loan of 500 SDG to purchase more material to make clothing. Paulino has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Paulino would like to increase the size of her business, to have a good store and a new sewing machine.

Her major challenges include the competitors in the market with good sewing machines, which leads to her low income.   

Paulino says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, especially for helping women in terms of giving loans to people like her with a small-scale business.

loans.use: to purchase more material to make clothing

loans.name: Gandaria 3 Group

texts.en: Taryamah is 52 years old. She is a widow with two children. She is selling snacks and ice from her rented house. She has been doing this business since 2010. The business is going well. With the income, she can buy food and pay the rent. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She wants to use this loan to increase her capital and buy more variations of snacks and ice to sell. In the future she wants to buy a house and have her own shop. Also she wants to go on a hajj (pilgrimage) to Mecca.

loans.use: to buy more variations of snacks and ice to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a single mother of five children aged 22-17 living in Hioma, Uganda. She owns a restaurant which she has been running for ten years. She faces a challenge of high rate of default and her dream is a big hotel in town. Daisy needs another loan to buy sodas and water for resale.

loans.use: to buy sodas and water for resale.

loans.name: Phou

texts.en:
Phou is 18 years old and a single woman who is living in Kompong Chhnang province. She lives with her grandmother, mother and her siblings. Phou is a rubber plantation worker, earning approximately $35.00 per month. 

Phou’s older sister is the one who is responsible for the whole family but presently she got a serious illness by accident. Phou is concerned about her older sister’s illness. And now she is decided to request a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to pay for medicines and treatment of illness. She wishes her older sister will become well soon. She is very thankful to all Kiva’s funders who are always generous and will help her family from this bad situation.

loans.use: to pay for medicines and treatment of illness.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is widowed and blessed with three children. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. She has been selling porridge for the last 20 years to support her family. She also does farming for more income. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She has requested a loan of 60,000 to buy ingredients such as maize flour, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sorghum, millet and maize flour.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen sews clothes to financially support her husband. Due to her high-quality work, she receives regular orders every month. She charges 150 PKRs per dress and uses that income to pay her children's school fees. She has a daughter and a son. Her son is in fifth standard while her daughter is studying in class ninth. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to the passengers. 

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, her husband will repair his rickshaw because its engine is creating a problem. 

She is very hopeful that after repairing his rickshaw, her husband will be able to provide better transport services to passengers and earn more profit.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She has been selling cereals for the last five years to support her family. She also does farming to increase her income. In the next five years, she wants to establish a wholesale business. Rhoda has requested a loan of 18,000 KES to buy beans and maize for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 26 years old and single. For the past three years, he has sold second-hand clothes. Clement earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES. 

Clement is requesting his first loan with KADET LTD to purchase more clothing to sell. He will use his anticipated profit to expand his business. In the future, Clement hopes to own a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Mutuo

texts.en:
Mutuo is married and blessed with three children. For the past four years, she has been running a grocery business to earn a living. Mutuo is also a farmer. Her potential customers are people in her local community and she employs two people to assist her in her business. 

Mutuo is requesting a 25,000 KES loan to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and vegetables to sell. Thanks to Falulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt a culture of saving. Mutuo hopes to establish a wholesale business in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and vegetables

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 33-year-old lady married to Saul, a 35-year-old man. Maria and Saul adopted a little girl named Marsella from her relatives. Marsella, who is 10, is studying at the 3rd grade in Elementary School. 

In order to meet their family needs, Maria’s husband runs an electronics (e.g. television, radio, tape recorder etc) repair shop business. As the income generated from the business is unstable, Maria took the initiative to sell gasoline in front of her house to support her husband in meeting their family needs. She has been running the business for almost five years. 

Maria intends to add more gasoline for her business after she saw the opportunity to serve people who do not have time to stand in line at the gasoline station, particularly in the morning when they should go to work and school. It would allow her business product to be sold out quickly. 

This situation led her to seek a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She plans to purchase more gasoline to sell. She hopes that TLM will assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en: Ulambayar is requesting a loan to purchase building materials to adjust and decorate his house.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to renovate his house

loans.name: Brettah

texts.en:
Brettah is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. Brettah operates a business where she sells cereals and she employs one person to help her run her business. Her potential customers are people in her  local community. Previously, Brettah was a farmer.

Brettah is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy beans and maize to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Mikocheni Group

texts.en: Helena is a single wO. in her early 20s. Last year, she opened a small hair-weaving business. Helena works from midday to 9 p.m. each day and earns a fair monthly profit. This is Helena's first loan with Tujijenge. With this loan, she hopes to buy more threads for her hair-weaving business and also begin selling sarongs. In the future, Helena dreams of opening a full-service salon. She will share this loan with her borrower group, Mikocheni. Mikocheni has 17 members and they hold each other accountable for paying back loans.

loans.use: to buy more threads for her hair-weaving business.

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en:
Maritha has operated her restaurant business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. She is 52 years old and married to Mwangi. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD through an existing client and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of sugar, maize flour, soft drinks and serviettes for use in her restaurant.

In the future, Maritha hopes to expand her business and be able to offer a good education to her children as well as improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, soft drinks and serviettes for use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a single woman who is 40 years old and has two children. She lives in Mtito Andei in Kibwezi where her business is. She is a tailor and has been in this business for 14 years now. Pauline gets a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.

This will be Pauline's third loan with KADET LTD. With this loan she plans to buy a solar panel to be used for lighting her house and business at night. In the future, Pauline wants to open a school for dressmaking and tailoring.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel to be used for lighting her house and business at night.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of beads

loans.name: Messak

texts.en:
Messak is a 49-year-old carpenter married to Dorkas, a 43-year-old lady. They are blessed with eight children:  Lexy, 23 and married; Yanre, 21, a farmer; Eleazer, 18,  graduated from Senior High School; Steven, 15, and Mariana, 13, both are attending Junior High School; Neny, 9, and Reza, 6, are attending Primary School and Astin, 3.    

Working as a carpenter brings such satisfaction for Messak. He has been engaged in this business for years. He produces window and door frames based on the customers’ order. The income generated from the business is unstable and often insufficient to fully cover their living as well as the educational fees of his children.  

In order to earn more income, Messak is thinking of initiating other businesses. He plans to rent a plot of land for five years and purchase four sacks of corn seed and fertilizer. He would like to cultivate corn at the farm and to sell it after the harvest. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM. He hopes that TLM will approve his loan application soon.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land and purchase four sacks of corn seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for laborers working in her rice field and partially fix her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mangoes, tomatoes, onions and apples

loans.name: Yeni

texts.en:
Yeni is a 31-year-old entrepreneur who is living in a simple house with her husband Sefron, a 33-year-old, and their three children.  Yesri, 16, is in the first grade of Senior High School.  Yevan, 9, is in the fourth grade of Elementary school. Marvend, 5, is in kindergarten.

Yeni has been running a kiosk business for the past nine years. She runs the business in order to help her husband generate more income to cover their family needs. 

Yeni plans to expand the business by adding more stock for her kiosk. Yeni believes that the income from this business will enable her to support her children, particularly for their education. She realizes that her children will need a lot of money for their education in the future. Therefore, Yeni is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.

She would like to spend the loan on kerosene, gasoline, mobile phone recharges and additional stocks, i.e. soap, cooking oil, flour, sugar, brooms, and medicine for her kiosk. Yeni really hopes that TLM is willing to assist her with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase kerosene, gasoline, mobile phone recharges, soap, cooking oil, flour, sugar, brooms, and medicine

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 41 years old.  She is a single mother of one six-year-old child.  Rachael sells clothes and has been in this business for six years.  She earns KES 6,000 a month from the business.

This is her first loan from Kiva partner KADET.  Rachael will use the loan to purchase more clothes for resale.  She will reinvest the profits she earns into her business.  Rachael's dream is to own a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en:
Reginah is a 42-year-old, married woman with three children.  To earn a living, she sells clothes, table clothes and mosquito nets.  Reginah has been in this business for seven years and employs one person.  She also runs a salon to earn extra income.  Reginah started the salon business after getting start-up capital from Kiva partner Faulu Kenya.

Reginah has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes for sale in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 37-year-old, single man.  He has earned a living from pig farming for three years.  Francis has been able to maintain his business because of his good reputation with customers. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. 

Francis has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy animal feed for his pig farming business. Since Francis joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for his pig farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sheep and benefit the sale of sheep products.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, 37, is humble villager from the Ornlong Veng District in Siem Reap Province.  He has spent most of his life cultivating rice crops alongside his wife. Sok and his wife earn a good profit from their farming business.  He works tirelessly to support his children’s education.  Sok earns additional income by working as a manual laborer for tradespeople in the local area.  At the workplace, he earns money by using his physical strength to carry heavy things like bags of rice and beans. 

In the next few months, Sok will start harvesting his rice crop and then be engaged with threshing.  He owns an old threshing machine, but it does not work well.  Sok would like to ask for a loan from Kiva partner Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) to fix his old threshing machine.  This loan will help this family to reduce the time and labor required to thresh his rice products this year.  In the future, Sok hopes to expand his farming business and provide his three children good opportunities to study at the University level.

loans.use: to fix his old threshing machine to reduce the time and labor required to process rice products.

loans.name: Gandaria 5 Group

texts.en: Hayati is married and a mother of two children. She has been doing laundry for two years. She runs the business from her house. The business is going well. She can help her husband to provide food for the family. Beside laundry, she also sells snacks. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. With this loan, she wants to buy more laundry soap and fragrances. In the future, she hopes she can have a bigger kiosk so that she can receive more laundry orders. She wants her children to graduate from the University, because she only graduated from high school.

loans.use: to buy more laundry soap and fragrances

loans.name: Erdene-Ochir

texts.en:
Erdene-Ochir, 42, is a taxi driver.  Since 2008, he has run his business in the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Erdene-Ochir has gained enough experience to continue his business in the future. He lives with his wife and two sons in his brother’s house.  

Erdene-Ochir's wife recently started a new textile business with her sister.  They run the textile business from their rental apartment. The textile business preparations are going well, but they need sewing tools and raw materials to start the work.  Exactly MNT 1,000,000 is needed to purchase the sewing materials.  Therefore, Erdene-Ochir requests a loan to support his wife so she can purchase textiles, a sewing machine, and other tools to start the new business.

loans.use: To support his wife so she can purchase textiles, a sewing machine, and other tools to start her new textile business.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.fr:
Alphonse  est né au Rwanda et a 58 ans. Il est marié avec 6 enfants de 14 à 36 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de primaire. 
Alphonse est salarie. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des cochons, construire la ferme des cochons et payer main d’œuvre. 
Alphonse voudrait faire l’élevage moderne des cochons. Il voudrait  être un agri-éleveur moderne scolariser ses enfants et assure le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alphonse was born in Rwanda.  He is 58 years old, married, and has six children aged between 14 and 36.  Two of his children are in school.  Alphonse studied three years at elementary school.

Alphonse is a worker who earns a salary.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy pigs, build a pig farm and pay labor costs.

Alphonse would like to raise pigs in a modern way.  He would like to be a modern pig farmer, to educate his children and to ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy pigs, to build a pig farm, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Njua

texts.en:
She is 51 years old. She is married and has five children with just one of them below fifteen years old. She lives in a five bedroom apartment with her family in mile Two Nkwen, Bamenda, Mezam Division, North west Region of Cameroon. The death of her two grand children and the theft of her goods are the major challenges she has faced in her life.

She joint GHAPE in 2000 and has received and successfully repaid Empowerment Credit several times. She invested her past loans in the sale of cloth and used the profit to feed and educate her children. Given a loan, she will stock men, women and children’s dresses which she will carry to rural areas for sale. She believes that this business will be a great success because she has many years of experience in this line of business and also because it is very profitable. The business activity will be of help to the community in that people in the rural areas will easily have dresses without having to go to town to buy dresses.

With the profit from this loan, she will increase her house in size. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the interest rate in moderate, the install mental method of repayment is convenient to her

loans.use: to purchase of clothing for men, women and children to sell in rural communities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hatcheries to expand her business.

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en:
Auntie has a senior high level of education.  She is married and has seven children.  Auntie sells provisions from the shop in which she is standing, located in Elmina, Ghana.  Her business is about fifteen years old.  Auntie helps her spouse to take care of her children. 

Auntie requests a loan that will be used to buy more provisions to sell in the shop.  She hopes to use the new profits to buy a land.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Kachena S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kachena S.H.G. Group in Western Kenya! Reginalda is the facilitator of the Kachena S.H.G.group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Reginalda takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Reginalda had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on two acres of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Reginalda was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on two acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Reginalda and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. With income from maize sales, Reginalda will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Kachena S.H group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica operates a shop in Elmina, Ghana where she sells sanitary pads, tooth paste, Milo, toilet paper and other items.  She is married with six children. She supports her companion to educate her children. 

Monica requests a loan to buy provisions for sale in her shop. She hopes to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: to buy provisions for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
Foday, a 42-year-old married father of two children, ages 12 and 18, both of whom attend school, runs a clothing store in Fullah town, located in the central area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. In this business for 25 years, Foday sells trousers, shirts, blouses and bags at his store. His wife conducts a business importing products from the United States of America. His main business challenges are price inflation, stock shortages, and transportation difficulties.

Foday has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more clothing items. He says that the resulting extra income will help improve his family's living conditions. Grateful for your support, Foday would like to invest in a variety of locations In the future.

loans.use: to purchase more trousers, shirts, blouses ans bags.

loans.name: Adalat

texts.ru:
Adalat 31 qod. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Adalat jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Uje 6 let on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtbi kupit korovi dlya uvelichesniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Adalat is 31 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives with his family in the Fuzuli region.  Adalat is married and has one child.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for six years and breeds cattle.  He currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity for sale.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more assorted fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia moves around in the vicinity of Elmina to sell slippers and cloth. She is married to a farmer and together they live with their four children. Her husband is a farmer. Emelia assists her spouse in taking care of her children. Emelia will use the loan to obtain slippers and cloth for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emelia plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to obtain slippers and cloth for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a hair dresser and she sells slippers on the side. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. The income she makes from her sales is used to assist her spouse to take care of the home. She is requesting for a loan from Kiva to buy other types of slippers to bring variety into her business.

loans.use: to buy other types of slippers to bring variety into her business.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina smokes fresh fish to sell in Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. Her educational background is up to the senior high school level. She wishes to increase the quantity of fish she sells, so a loan will help acquire additional fresh fish to sell. Any profits realized will be reinvested for further growth.

She is married and has five children. Her husband is a carpenter.

loans.use: to acquire additional fresh fish to resell.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a driver. The loan will be used to acquire bags of maize to make banku.

Benedicta sells banku in Elmina. Banku/akple is fermented corn/cassava dough mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish paste, and is served with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish.

To prepare banku, she first prepares the corn dough (maize that has been milled and left for a day) and cassava dough. She mixes the cassava and corn dough and cooks them into a porridge-like consistency. To get the right consistency, she has to stir the mixture on a hot firewood stove. The texture of banku has to be fine, but firm.

The accompanying dish can be any kind of soup or sauce such as palm nut soup, groundnut soup or peanut soup, okra soup, or hot pepper sauce with fish of any kind. The most popular side dish for banku is okra stew.

loans.use: to acquire bags of maize for her business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a single parent taking care of four children. The loan will serve as additional income to buy maize to make kenkey.

Efua sells kenkey in Elmina. To prepare her kenkey, she buys maize from the market and soaks it in water to soften the maize for three days. On the third day, she washes the maize and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it for a day.

She divides the risen dough into two. She mixes one part with water to make a porridge-like consistency form cooks it until it is firm, but not fully cooked. She mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough. She moulds the dough into balls and wraps them in corn husk. She then cooks them again till they become soft enough to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce. It is often served with meat or fish such as fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, and roasted turkey.

loans.use: to buy maize to make kenkey.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has been involved in the milk business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year. He is 22 years old and single.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more milk stock for sale in his shop.

In the future, Joel hopes to expand his milk business to more areas in Ndunyu Njeru town and to become one of the leading milk traders and distributors in the area.

loans.use: to buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is divorced and has 8 children. Ama sells kenkey and fried fish at Elmina, which she has done for 4 years. She sees to the general upkeep of her home with the income from the selling of the fish and kenkey. Ama will use the loan to purchase sacks of maize and fresh fish to fry for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save towards buying land.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize and fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward has been extracting stones from quarries in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He is 58 years of age.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officer and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy tools for his quarry so as to increase production and efficiency in his business.

In the future, Edward hopes to expand his business by buying more land for the quarry business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy tools for his quarry business.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has 6 children. She is readying the plantain leaves she will be using to rap the dough for the kenkey she sells in Elmina, which she has done for 6 years. Her husband is a farmer. She supports her husband in educating her children. Aba will use the loan to purchase maize to prepare kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase maize to prepare kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.ru: Fuad ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda,seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione v posolke Dilagarda vmeste so svoyey mamoy. Fuad 28 let. On uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje zanimalsya skotovodstvom.
texts.en: Fuad is not married and does not have children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives with his mother in the Dilagarda village of the Fuzuli region.  Fuad is 28 years old.  He has been involved in animal husbandry and breeding cattle for three years.  He learned this business from his father, who was also involved in animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Francess M Y

texts.en:
Frances is 48 years old and married with 2 children, ages 27 and 30. She runs a general merchandise store in Goderich, in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She has two additional dependents that live with her because they are relatives from the village.  

In 2004, Frances established her general merchandise business. She began this business because she needed a permanent source of income to support her family. She sells general merchandise such as Maggie, soft drinks, tomato past, butter, seasoning (stew seasoning), and onions at her store. Even though she sells a wide variety of products, price fluctuations have become difficult for her to manage.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more pop drinks, bags of onions, sardines and mayonnaise. Frances says that the extra income from this loan will help her cover her children’s education costs and improve her family’s standard of living. In the future, she would like to open shops in different locations and also do international business.

loans.use: to buy more pop drinks, bags of onions, sardines and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame makes shea butter to sell in Elmina. She is married and has 4 children. She has been making shea butter for 40 years. The income from her sales is used to assist her partner to pay the utility bills. Her loan will be used to procure ingredients to make shea butter. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to procure ingredients to make shea butter.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hardworking business man aged 49. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last seven years, he has been practicing dairy farming to support his family. He also runs a cafeteria for more income. Joseph has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loan to boost his business. With KES 25,000, he wants to buy ingredients such as sugar, cooking fat and wheat flour to make doughnuts.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat and wheat flour.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 33 years old. She is married to Daniel and together they have three children aged nine, seven and four years old. She operates a green grocer and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 6,560 from the business.

This is her first loan term in KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to buy tomatoes, potatoes ,vegetables and fruits for resale. She will pay school fees for her children from the anticipated profits. Her dream is to build a home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Apokori Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Apokori Group in Western Kenya!  Patrick is the facilitator of the Apokori group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Patrick takes care of 12 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Patrick will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Apokori group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the picture.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 37 years old. She is a single mother of two children aged 18 and three years old. She operates a cosmetic shop and has been in the business for one year. She has a monthly income of KES 20,250.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of cosmetics and hair pieces to sell. She will expand her business with the anticipated profits. Her dream is to be the best cosmetics supplier in the area.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics and hair pieces to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 19 years. She is 42 years old, married to Joseph ,and they have six children who go to school.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

In the future, Mary hopes to own a pick-up to assist her in transporting the farm produce to the market and to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Daniel Kariuki

texts.en:
Daniel has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 23 years. This is his seventh loan and he has paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He used his previous loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer, which he planted, and it it was very profitable.

He plans to use this loan amount to buy more seedlings and fertilizer as well as other farm inputs.

Daniel hopes to improve his farming skills and become a leading farmer in Ndunuy Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 56 years old, married to Florence and they have three children who go to school.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He repaid all his previous loans in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seedlings and fertilizer for use in his farm.

In the future, Patrick hopes to become one of the leading snow pea farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is a hardworking business man aged 51. He is married and blessed with five children and two of them attend school. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last sixteen years to support his family. In the next 5 years, he wants to increase the number of cows in his farm. Elijah dreams of becoming more financially stable. He has requested a loan of KES 100,000 to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Njuguna

texts.en:
Njuguna has operated his cereal business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years.  He is 50 years old,and married to Loise and they have three children who go to school.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more assorted cereals to sell in his shop.

In the future, Njuguna hopes to expand his cereal business and make more income and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more assorted cereals for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells food items and second-hand clothes. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in this business for four years. She supports her husband in educating her children. Her loan will be used to buy second-hand clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aladin

texts.ru: Aladin yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda,seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione v posolke Bala Bakhmanli vmeste so svoyey  drujelubnoy semyoy. Aladin jenat i imeyet 2 detey.  Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi. 11 let nazad on nachal zanimatsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Aladin is an Internally Displaced Person from the town of Fuzuli, now living in Fuzuli Region, in the village of Bala Bakhmanli, together with his loving family. Aladin is married and has two children. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle. He first started raising cattle 11 years ago.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua has three children. She sells cassava, plantain, fresh pepper, tomatoes, onions and other items at Elmina. She has done this for four years. Her husband is a farmer. Akosua uses her income for general upkeep of their home. Akosua will use the loan to obtain cassava, plantain, fresh pepper, tomatoes, onions and other items to resell. She anticipates building a shop one day.

loans.use: to obtain cassava, plantain, fresh pepper, tomatoes, onions and other items

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Benedicta makes cassava dough at Elmina, which she has done for six years. In this picture, she has placed some logs of wood on the dough to take out the water from the milled cassava. Benedicta uses her earnings to assist her husband in paying their children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase fresh cassava to make dough to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Benedicta plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase fresh cassava to make dough

loans.name: Ewura

texts.en: Ewura, who sells kenkey and fried fish in Elmina, is married to a farmer, and together they have five children. She sees to the general upkeep of the home as a way of supporting her husband. Her loan will be used to buy more maize for kenkey and fresh fish to fry. Ewura hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university eduation of her children.

loans.use: to buy maize for kenkey and fresh fish to fry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy body lotions, perfumes, bathing soap, hair weaves, wigs, necklaces, and bracelets.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Aba sells cooked food (wakye) at Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Aba uses her income to assist her spouse to take care of her children. Aba will use the loan to purchase rice and beans to cook and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans to cook and sell.

loans.name: Wa'el

texts.en: Wa'el is a 47-year-old man; he is married with no children yet. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Wa'el wants to make repairs to his house such as changing tiles, changing windows and doors, etc., but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Wa'el gets the loan, he will be able to repair his house and offer his family better living conditions. Wa'el is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to make repairs to his house and improve it to live in conditions

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 27 years.  She is 46 years old, married to Githia, and they have six school-aged children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan.  She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs and hire labor.

In the future, Jane hopes to improve her farming skills and make more profits, thereby improving the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and hire labor

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. She is into kenkey production, which she has done for 10 years. To prepare her kenkey, she buys maize from the market and soaks it in water to soften the maize for three days. On the third day, she washes the maize and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it for a day.

She divides the risen dough into two. She mixes one with water to get it into a porridge-like consistency form and cooks it until it is firm, but not fully cooked. She later mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough. She molds the dough into balls and wraps them in corn husks. She then cooks them again till they become soft enough to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce. It is often served with meat or fish, such as fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, and roasted turkey. 

Araba will use the loan to procure sacks of maize to make kenkey.

loans.use: to procure sacks of maize to make kenkey.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is married to a corn mill operator and they are blessed with five children. She sells groceries. As part of her responsibilities, she supports her husband to pay the utility bills. Maame will use the loan to purchase provisions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to open another shop.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena, the mother of three children, is married to a farmer.  Moving from one place to another in Elmina, Abena has been selling cooked food for 10 years, using her income to assist her spouse in taking care of their children. Abena will use the loan to purchase more food items to cook and sell. With the new profits arising from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook and sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 25 years old and single.  To earn a living, he runs a grocery.  He has been in the business for two years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and has also learned how to save his money. Peter hopes to expand his business.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en:
Nehemiah has been in the business of farming supplies and products in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He is 43 years old, married to Margaret, and they have five school-aged children.  

He was introduced to KADET  LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his seventh loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to support his horticultural contract business.

In the future, Nehemiah hopes to expand his business and directly export the farm products to other markets both within Kenya and abroad.

loans.use: to support his horticultural contract business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Hassan from Aberdeen, in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with an 11-year-old son. His child is currently attending school. 

Hassan runs a general merchandise store in Aberdeen.  He sells drinks, iron rods, toiletries, paint, biscuits, and provisions. He has been running this business for four years.  He also earns income from his taxi business. He says that the main challenge to his business is that he needs electricity to cool his water and drinks.

Hassan has requested a loan in order to buy more drinks, cement, and iron rods. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to open branches of the same business. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, cement, iron rods, and mosquito spray to sell at his store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years.  He is 62 years-old and married to Margaret. While his retail business is his primary activity, Joseph also practices farming. 

He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy more stock such as sugar, tea leaves and match boxes to sell in his retail shop.  He also will buy some farm materials. 

In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale and also increase his farming thereby increasing his income in order to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as sugar, tea leaves, match boxes and farm materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Lima Oyoole Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lima Oyoole Group in Western Kenya! Humphrey is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Humphrey takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure quality education for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Humphrey had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on three quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Humphrey was only able to harvest four bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Humphrey and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Humphrey will repay his loan to the firm and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Lima Oyoole group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

He is pictured in the group with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 51 years-old. He is married to Millicent and together they have four children aged 30, 26, 23 and 20 years-old.

He works in a quarry besides keeping poultry. He has been in the business for the past two years. He gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from his business.

This is his first loan term from Kiva partner KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase another quarry.  He will use the anticipated profit to expand his poultry business. His dream is to become a chicken supplier  to large hotels

loans.use: to purchase another quarry.

loans.name: Nusra

texts.en:
Nusra is a 43-year-old married woman, and a mother to three sons and one daughter. 

Four years ago she started a small retail business selling medicA. covers and sheets, then she bought a sewing machine and decided to start making those sheets and sell them by herself. It has been two years since she started sewing the medicA. sheets, and she finds it better to do it herself. 

Now Nusra want to buy more materiA. and tools needed to make more sheets, and in the future she wants to have her own sewing and tailoring workshop with a good number of employees to make those types of sheets and covers.

loans.use: to buy more material and tools needed to make more medical sheets

loans.name: Anahi

texts.es: Anahi tiene una tienda de barrio donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, donde su madre la ayuda con la atención de la misma,  ya que Anahi es profesora.. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar  azúcar, fideo y arroz al por mayor para así aumentar capital y al mismo tiempo reducir costos.  Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Alpacoma  en  la ciudad de El Alto;  es soltera  y tiene un hijo. Anahi es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2010 y esta será la primera vez que su crédito sea enviado a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en:
Anahí has a neighborhood grocery store where she sells basic staples; her mother helps her tend to customers since Anahí is a Teacher.  She will use the loan to buy sugar, noodles and rice at wholesale to increase capital while reducing costs.

She lives in her parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Alpacoma zone; she’s single and has a son.  Anahí has been an IMPRO client since 2010 and this will be the first time her loan has been sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles and rice at wholesale for her grocery store.

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad is 37 years old, has been married since 2005, and recently welcomed his third child. 

Three years ago he opened a stationary store in Al Zarqa. In the beginning he used to sell basic stationary items with not much of a collection, now his store is selling not only stationary items but also kid's toys and gifts. 

Now Muhannad wants to expand more by adding more toys before the holiday season comes, that's why he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To add more toys and gifts before the holiday season comes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. She also practices dairy farming from which she gets milk to sell.  She is 40 years-old, married to Michael and they have five school going children.  

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm materials and fertilizer for use in her farm during this planting season.

In the future, Agnes hopes to improve both her farming skills and dairy farming so as to get more income as well as educate their children.

loans.use: to buy farm materials and fertilizer.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 30 years-old and married to Tom.  The are blessed with two children.  She operates a butcher shop in the area of Tala. She has been in this business for the last year and gets an income of KES.12,000 per month.

Serah is applying for her first loan of KES.20,000 from Kiva partner KADET LTD. With the loan, she plans to purchase more meat to sell and make soup.  She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children.

Serah hopes to have a self driven business. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell and make soup.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another quarry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old. He is married to Wilkister and together they have three children. He sells jikos, metal boxes, and sufurias. He has been in the business for the past six years. He gets a monthly income of KES 9,990 from the business.

This is his first loan term from KADET. He will use the loan amount to purchase metallic boxes for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children.

His dream is to educate his children to the college level and build a home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase metal boxes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 59 years old, married to Amos, and together they are blessed with four children. She does rabbit keeping in Dandora Phase ll. She has been in this business for the last year and gets an income of KES 10,000 per month.

Margaret has a good credit history with KADET and she is applying for her second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET, which she plans to use to buy more rabbits. 

She will use the anticipated profits to venture into farming. Margaret hopes to venture into large scale farming. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits for sale

loans.name: Tamara Liseth

texts.es: Tamara mujer trabajadora, emprendedora con el préstamo anterior logro ingresar nuevos productos de cosméticos y aumento sus ventas siendo de gran beneficio para su familia.  Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, laminas de zinc, perlines y ladrillos. Para cambiar el techo que está en mal estado, repechar las paredes y colocar ladrillos en el piso que actualmente es de cemento. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a que ella realice los cambios necesarios de los cuales se obtendrán mayor comodidad y seguridad para su familia y negocio.
texts.en:
Tamara is an entrepreneurial working woman. With her previous loan she added a new line of cosmetics and the increased sales have been a great help to her family.
