She leads a group of two members. Nuy and the other member of the group are applying for their first loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizer for the farmland and plant more rice. Nuy hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and earn more income to feed her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 35-year-old married woman who has no children. She has been selling beans and onions in Yei county, South Sudan for four years. Her husband is a driver.
Sadia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions for sale. She will use the extra income to build a store and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sewing equipment.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a hardworking businesswoman, age 32. She is married and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. For the last three years, she has been rearing poultry to support her family. Lucy has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chicken. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with a previous loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 58 years old and married with 7 children aged 17-40 living in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. He has dependents and he is the only income earner in the family.

For two years he has been running a business of house renting and this has facilitated him in providing for his family. He started as a motor vehicle stage guide and after saving enough of his wages he started to build the house that he is renting out. He hopes to construct more houses in the future to rent. John needs the loan to renovate his house.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en: Dudu has been selling beans and fish in Yei, South Sudan for six years. She is 40 years old; a married woman with five children. Three of her children are in school. Her husband is a businessman. Dudu requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans for sale. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and fish for sale.

loans.name: Vannat's Group

texts.en: Vannat is married and a 41 years-old mother of 5 children. Her oldest child is married while the other four are still single. Her husband is a painter and has been painting for more than 20 years to support the family. Vannat sometimes works for others for additional income. She leads a group of 4 members. Vannat and other members of the group are requesting a second loan with VisionFund. She wants to buy ink for her husband's painting. She hopes this loan will enable her husband to increase his painting and earn more income to feed her family, and set aside some money for the future needs.

loans.use: to buy ink for painting.

loans.name: Army Group

texts.en:
Joan is a mother with four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Joan had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joan was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ an acres of land. With income from maize sales, Joan will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

Joan is the facilitator of the Army group. Joan and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Army group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land. Joan is photographed with her group members.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February, 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a hard working father responsible for taking care of his family. He is 46 years old, married, and has three children. One of his children is married, the other one is working, and the youngest is only two years old. His wife has been engaged in a retail shop business while he runs their livestock business. Manuel is raising pigs for fattening and he has been in this kind of business for almost 20 years. He is grateful that his pig fattening is getting better. 

Manuel would like to provide for all the needs of his growing piglets so that when they reach their optimum growth he could sell them for a higher price. Due to the high cost of basic commodities and increase in household expenses, Manuel suffered from shortage of funds. For this reason, he is asking for financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to P10,000 which will be used in buying feeds needed in his hog raising and groceries for his wife's retail shop business. He is hoping for improvement of his business and to support his children until such time that they could finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and groceries for his hog raising and his wife's retail shop business

loans.name: Alizhan

texts.ru: Алижан – веселый, добродушный и жизнерадостный человек. Ему 42 года,  женат,  отец троих детей.  Алижан -  шахтер, работает на шахте в г. Казарман по 15 дней в месяц. Пять лет назад, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Алижан начал свой бизнес в разведении скота и реализации сельхозпродукции на местном рынке.  Начав со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день его ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 4,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Алижан обратился в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и закупа сельхоз продукции на реализацию. В будущем, Алижан мечтает дать хорошее образование своим детям.
texts.en: Alizhan is a happy, kind and buoyant person.  He is 42 years old, married and is a father of three children.  Alizhan is a miner and works at a mine in the town of Kazarman 15 days per month.  Five years ago, in search of an additional income, he started his own business of breeding livestock and selling agricultural products at the local market.  Having started with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS), Alizhan's current monthly profit is about 4,000 som.  In order to further expand his business, Alizhan requested a loan in the sum of 75,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for the purchase of livestock and agricultural products for sale.  In the future, Alizhan dreams of providing a good education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and agricultural crops for sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 30 years old. She is a married woman who has four children; two of them are in school. She has been selling cassava flour and beans in Yei, South Sudan, for five years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans for sale. She hopes to open a nursery school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and beans for sale.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is 43 years old. She is widowed and has five children; three of them are daughters. Making a living and supporting her family, she has been working for others for around 20 years. 

She is a leader of a six-member group. Sokhom and other members of the group are applying for a second loan with VisionFund. She wants to build a house for living in. She hopes this loan will help her to have a decent accommodation for her family.

loans.use: to build a house for living in.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 42 years of age. She is a kind and responsible parent to her family. She is thankful because her husband supports her in running their business. Rosemarie has been involved in the livestock business for six years up to nowadays. She is glad that her husband is her helper in feeding them daily. 

The couple has been blessed with three children; two of them finished their studies while the youngest is still studying. Rosemarie aims that her youngest child could also finish her studies, so the couple does their best to provide for their family's needs. According to her, she would like to improve her livestock business and make it more profitable so that she could save some and support her student. With her dreams for her child and business, Rosemarie is encouraged to join the program suited for her livestock business. In this way, she could improve and maintain her business. 

Rosemarie is requesting a loan amounting to 25,000 Philippines pesos, which will enable her to buy feeds, vitamins and an additional piglet to be raised. She hopes that through her requested loan, she could fulfill her dreams in life.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and an additional piglet for her livestock business.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 55 years of age. She is married with six siblings. She presently lives at Barangay Lourmah, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She has had this gardening business for more than 10 years, and she used this business to support her financial needs. She requested a loan amount of 14,000 pesos to purchase more fertilizers for her farm.

Alberta has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost three years. In the future, Alberta hopes that through the help of PMPC, she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Mukhili Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Group Mukhili SHG in Western Kenya!  Peter is the facilitator of the Mukhili SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Peter takes care of 13 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Peter had a very good maize yield harvesting 21 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Peter was only able to harvest 1 1/2 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Peter will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Mukhili SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph with their Field Officer, Robert Marufu, who is on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 36 years old. She is married with three children. To earn a living, she sells cereals. She has been in the business for five years. She has employed one person in her business. Even though she runs her business in a competitive environment, she is able to retain her customers because of her good customer care.  

Caroline hopes to expand her business in the future. She has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to build a storage facility and to pay school fees.

loans.use: To build a storage facility and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Pos' Group

texts.en: Pos is 51 years old, married and has nine children. She has been farming on her land for 33 years to earn a living. She also raises pigs for additional income. She leads a group of two members. Pos is requesting a first loan with VisionFund. She wants to grow rice and buy pig feed. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more rice and feed her pigs to be healthy and fat to earn more income to feed her family and increase her savings to buy more piglets for the future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Jua Kali C Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jua Kali C Group in Western Kenya! Jesca is the facilitator of Jua Kali C group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jesca takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jesca had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Jesca was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jesca and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Jesca will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Jua Kali C group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture, the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo is a local farmer as well as a pig raiser. She has been engaged in this business for a long time. Through this, she can generate approximately $2.50 per day. Presently she lives with her husband and one child in Kompong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband always works alongside her on the rice field, especially during the rainy season. Moreover, he is a Khmer white wine distiller. He has run this business well, and it is located in his own home. This couple try very hard to raise their child and satisfy their family’s needs. Keo wants to expand her farmland and increase her rice products, which can provide her with more profit. Now she is asking for a loan from Kiva to supplement her capital to buy a plot of land from her neighbor. This loan will help this family increase their income. With the increase in income, she’ll save it for the education of her child and for the growth of the business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land from her neighbor.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a married man with three children.  To earn a living, he runs a school. He has employed seven people in the school.  He also does farming for extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and is becoming more financially stable.

Josphat hopes to expand the school to accommodate more students.  He has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to renovate the existing classrooms and build two more classrooms.

loans.use: To renovate the classrooms and build two more classrooms

loans.name: Raghada

texts.en:
Raghda is an 18-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Raghda is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Raghda is looking to improving her family's living conditions.

Due to culturA. issues, the man in the photo is Raghda's husband.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 39-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Amal is selling clothes at her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more clothes for trading purposes.
Amal wants to increase her family income and improve their conditions.

Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is Amal's husband.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Chreng's Group

texts.en: Chreng is a 39-year-old mother of three children. For the last three years, she has been selling wine-making ingredients to support her family. She leads a group of three members. Chreng and other members have been with VisionFund for two years and are now applying for a third loan. She wants to buy wine-making ingredients and sell to the market. With this loan, she hopes to increase her stock and earn more income to feed her family and buy necessary household stuff.

loans.use: to buy wine-making ingredients

loans.name: Micahel

texts.en:
Micahel is 64 years old and married with seven children. He runs a cafeteria to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 10 years and has employed three people.  He also owns rental houses, which earn him extra income.  Previously, he was selling cereals for a living.
Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business because he has been trained on business management skills. Micahel has requested 80,000 Kenya shillings to start a business selling kerosene. Therefore, he wants to buy a kerosene pump.

loans.use: To buy a kerosene pump

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 42-year-old married woman form Madaba, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Fatima is producing milk and other dairy products from her home. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase goats and sheep.

Fatima is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase their living income.

loans.use: to purchase goats and sheep

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok is a 65-year-old farmer who has four children. He has been farming for over 30 years. Sok has been with VisionFund since 2008. He leads a group of 2 members. He completely paid his loans to VisionFund and now is applying for a third loan to cultivate a rice paddy. Sok hopes that this loan will enable him to improve his crop yields, earn more income to feed his family and set aside some savings. Most importantly, he hopes that he can keep his children in school.

loans.use: To cultivate a rice paddy.

loans.name: Sibumba Mission B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sibumba Mission B Group in Western Kenya! Batholomayo is the facilitator of the Sibumba Mission B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Batholomayo is a father of 2 children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Batholomayo had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Batholomayo was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Batholomayo and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Batholomayo will buy a piece of land and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Sibumba Mission B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Batholomayo is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.
